text: More like 3 stars but since the service was so great we'll do 4.Not sure why we ended up here but we did. Definitely was nervous how food would be since it's in a touristy area. I ordered the gnocchi based off reviews here but PLEASE do not order the gnocchi. Very plain, tastes like raw dough. Everyone else loved their meals. The bread is amazingggggg, the veal ravioli with pesto dish was great too. Spaghetti was good as well, simple with some tomatoes in it. Reason it's more of a 3 Star is just due to price. There is a lot more options in New York City for pasta that is as good or better, for a way cheaper price. Very big restaurant so if you have a large group this could be a place. If you're in the area and don't feel like traveling for somewhere else, it is good food.

Thank you so much Shilany! You are the best waitress and we appreciate your service and kindness and professionalism You always take such good care of your customers in every way and your smile. Great restaurant and staff and food. Highly recommend and for holiday parties too which my company did for 2018 and will do for 2019! Thank you again

As we ate our prosciutto and salami appetizer plates, the remainder of our dinner seemed promising. Unfortunately, that was the high point of the dinner. Our entrees were tasteless and boring. So disappointed.

Oh my, Casa Nonna, is the Italian restaurant of my dreams.  My friends and I went to Casa Nonna for dinner before catching a show.  I'm so happy we went here, I left feeling full and satisfied, and ready to sit for a 3 hour play.Upon arrival, it wasn't too crowded.  The restaurant is quite expansive for NYC.  I started with a glass of Chianti.  My friends and I ordered the amazing bruschetta and crispy Brussels Sprouts.  It was a perfect start to the meal.  The Bruschetta was a-plenty and the mustard-apple cider vinaigrette on the Brussels Sprouts was to die for.  So good!  For dinner I ordered the truffle ricotta gnocchi with wild mushrooms and Fava Beans and it was like I was eating candy.  It was so buttery and delicious.  I had no other choice but to eat the whole thing!  And to my surprise, I still had room to share the tiramisu.  My friends also raved about their meals.  Is there anything Casa Nonna can't do?Our waiter was very friendly.  He checked up on us a few times and made sure we were well taken care of.  Thanks for an excellent dinner Casa Nonna!

Disappointing. While the food was fine, the restaurant felt corporate and more like a large chain (even though it isn't) and not the cozy Italian family restaurant it's trying to pretend to be online.

We went to Casa Nonna for dinner. Our waiter never introduced himself, but the food was delicious. I had the garlic bread and the twisted pasta in a beef and pork ragu sauce. My boyfriend had octopus and a fish entree. The staff was very attentive and the place was quite large with several areas for large parties, including a private room towards the front of the restaurant. I would go again.
We ordered Truffle Ricotta Gnocchi and Frutty di Mare. The Gnocchi is a little greasy. Frutti di Mare is not bad. Then we had Panna Cotta for desert. This is good.

A ripoff! Two people. A salad (lettuce and grated cheese), spaghetti with tomato sauce, gnocchi, two glasses of house wine. No dessert. Total: $105 before tip. For this kind of place? No tablecloth? You've gotta be kidding.  As  for the service: if you don't mind the server addressing you and your lady (both of a certain age) as "you guys", you can say it's passable.

I've only been to Casa Nonna for lunch but I absolutely love this place! They have everything from delicious salads, paninis, pizza, and pasta. I've tried it all and it's never disappointed me! Their fried calamari and meatball appetizers are standout items and I would 100% recommend you add that to your order! Trust me you won't regret it. I usually get pollo sandwich and it's uh-mazing! I've had their seafood pasta and that was just alright, but their chicken parm was great! Definitely recommend Casa Nonna!

"Nonna, I'm still hungry"Still being hungry after going to Nonna's house is unheard of.I would leave my Nonnie's house in pain from eating so much.If you finished your plate, Nonnie would fill it back up saying, "have more".Not the case at Casa Nonna. The food was good. The service was excellent. But the portions were small. If I had ordered only my entree, I would  have left starving. I began with a butternut squash soup which was creamy and tasty. I also ordered a side of broccoli rabe because I was curious how it would taste. It wasn't bad, but it was bland. I usually saute it with garlic and olive oil and then let it simmer in chicken stock to develop more flavor. Then I had the Siamese Agnolotti pasta. Veal ragu, spinach & taleggio, truffled pecorino fonduta marsala glaze. I wasn't 100% sure what this pasta dish would be but the veal ragu sounded good. It turned out to be similar to small ravioli. Eight small ravioli stuffed half way with the veal ragu. The other half with the spinach taleggio. Topped with a light cream sauce and mushrooms. I ate it in about five minutes and I was taking my time. I should have tried a basic sauce with some pasta because my dish was bland. My wife had the Polpette Panini. A meatball sandwich with sauce, provolone and mozzerella. The sandwich was a lot better than my dinner. I wish I kept it simple and also ordered the meatball panini. My sister-in-law had the margarita pizza. Her pizza was pretty tasty. I felt the restaurant was over priced. Granted, I know it's in NYC. But come on!$17 for a meatball sandwich. $10 for a small side of broccoli rabe. $15 for a margarita pizza. And $26 for my small pasta dish. My dish was so small, I thought they made a mistake when the waiter brought the dish to me. I will not be recommending this restaurant to friends or family that travel to NYC.

Years ago, I had taken my brother to Casa Nonna for a special wine dinner hosted by Chef David Burke, their culinary consultant.  We had really enjoyed the experience, but I had completely forgotten about the destination, given that I am rarely hanging out in the neighborhood between Port Authority and Penn Station.  However, my friend recently asked me to find a dinner spot in that locale, and, after a quick search, I was reminded of this terrific option.  My friend was waiting for me at the packed bar, and when I arrived, she marveled at how spacious and vibrant the restaurant was.  She grabbed her glass of wine, and we followed the hostess to our table in the dining room.  I decided to skip a beverage that night, but we both munched on the complimentary flatbread, which was topped with a cheese and black pepper-crusted topping.  The zesty crisps were a necessary indulgence as we inhaled all of the seductive food smells swirling around us.  We decided to share a few plates, starting with the seasonal Pumpkin and Pear Salad.  Leaves of arugula and radicchio were topped with roasted pumpkin, caramelized pear, pumpkin seeds, and a pear-balsamic vinaigrette.  Thickly-cut slices of fresh ricotta salata were a welcome creamy addition to balance the acidity.  Next, we moved onto Whole Wheat Tagliatelle with squash, wild mushrooms, kale, and a truffle Parmesan sauce that was aromatic yet light.  The nutty noodles and vegetable accoutrements made it at least appear to have been a healthier selection.  Lastly, the Branzino was pan-seared for a crunchy skin covering moist meat.  It was elegantly lying over a bed of cannellini beans, escarole, sofrito, and a saffron aioli.  A smoked paprika oil was drizzled over the dish, bringing the Mediterranean flavors to the forefront.Casa Nonna provided a first-rate meal in an exciting atmosphere.  The fact that it was a culinary delight in the midst of an otherwise food wasteland was definitely an added bonus.

We were a group of 9 with no reservations on our first family trip to NYC. While other places would typically turn you away, Casa Nonna took us in. The place was full and the GM came out and found us an awesome table to accommodate us all, within 15 minutes. Everyone was super friendly and courteous. Food was Excellent!!! Highly recommend it.

I ordered the siamese agnolotti, and I was incredibly surprised! The fillings were super delicious, i ate it a nunber of ways - a whole, cut in half with the meat sauce on one sidr and the spinach sauce on the other, and also cut in half length wise so you get both sauces. No matter how it was suoer delicious. The dish is quite heavy as is served with melted butter, so come hungry.I also ordered brussell sprouts with roasted apples as a side, the combination was very nice. On top of that, my waiter was genuinely friendly, which i feel is difficult to find in NYC!

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in NYC! I have been coming here for years and always have had a great experience. We went there last night for dinner and it was just as amazing as always!First off, the bread is TO DIE FOR! It's very thin and crispy and has ricotta in the middle. I could honestly just eat this. We always ask for more!We then had the calamari, which is my favorite appetizer there! It is a mix of fried calamari and fried zucchini and has a delicious dipping sauce! Definitely a 5 star appetizer.My favorite pasta of all time is the butternut squash ravioli! They change their menu seasonally but I was very happy to see it was still on the menu last night. It's the perfect mix of sweet and salty!We were so full and didn't order dessert, but our waitress Maja was so amazing and brought us tiramisu on the house! It was truly the best tiramisu I have had in a long time! It was rich and full of flavor! The coffee sauce on the plate really added to it.Overall, I think that this is a must try if you are looking for a great midtown restaurant!

This year, I have started coming to NYC about once a month.  In January, I stayed near Penn Station for obvious reasons.  I found Casa Nonna and it is the reason I will always stay near Penn Station now.I love in Boston, I've eaten a lot of calamari...I am in love with and dream of Casa Nonna's version.As someone who frequently gets "to go" orders, I love the host staff here too.  They are super friendly and accommodating (I'm a picky customer).I just finished my calamari and beef tartare and can't wait to be back to order dinner again!

I really enjoyed this meal. My table ended up sharing a bunch of things:-meatballs: these were some of the best meatballs I've had at a restaurant-Caesar salad: really good dressing and a good portion size. The Parmesan bread that came with it was also really good. -burrata with prosciutto: amazing and the portion was a good size-butternut squash ravioli: this was good, but I probably wouldn't get it again. It was a large portion-Siamese agnolotti: this was amazing and one of my favorite dishes of the night even though I don't usually eat veal-Pici all's toscana: I enjoyed the flavor of this pasta but it was a little too al dente for me -chicken parm: I didn't really enjoy this dish. The chicken was over cooked and it wasn't hot when it arrived at our table.Overall, it was a great meal and I would return.

I had a pretty good experience at Casa Nonna. We were able to get a reservation easily and pretty last minute for a group of 6. I asked for a glass of dessert wine at the bar and they happened to have just one. They accommodated us even though some members of our party were half an hour late and the service was friendly all around. As for the food, I liked my spaghetti and thought the pasta was a great texture. I wouldn't say it was super unique. It had quite a lot of sauce and was a bit too salty and saucy for my taste but the texture of the pasta was perfect. My boyfriend and friend both got the chicken parm which was HUGE but only thought it was okay. I would recommend maybe trying some of their other entrees.Overall, I would recommend this place if you're in the area but it isn't my first pick for Italian food in Manhattan.

Couldn't get a reservation at Patsy's, so we gave this place a try. I had their version of Bolognese ( they call it something else), it was delicious! Homemade pasta and a perfectly seasoned bolognese made me feel like I made the right choice. Service was slow, but the restaurant was super busy. I would definitely recommend it!

Still one of the better spots in Manhattan to have a business lunch if you are looking for Italian food. The staff is great and so is the food, quite a few choices as well. This place is always packed at lunchtime so I suggest you make reservations .

Authentic Itialian food and pasta.     I ordered a bolognese pasta and the wife had a chicken parm with zucchini shaped pasta side .   Both came out quickly and very tasty.   We were in a hurry so we didn't have an appetizer or salad but did enjoy a cappuccino and a chocolate cake with gelato.   All of the food n drinks were spot on. The real beauty of this restaurant is the size and decor.    The tables are spread out and the wife and I even had a corner cushy booth with a loose pillow.   Highly recommend for MSG events or romantic evenings in the west 38th street locations.    Free parking after 7:00 pm in front of the restaurant.   Couldn't have been more pleased.     The waiter was perfect.  Didn't talk too much and was on his game !

Came here for lunch during restaurant week. I've been meaning to go here, so I was glad they were a part of restaurant week. The decoration and atmosphere in this restaurant was very quaint. There were paintings and photos everywhere. There was also a section where you can witness chefs tossing pizza in the air and sliding them into brick ovens. The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars is because the service was kind of slow. I would still come back & if I wasn't in such a hurry, slow service would have not been a big deal.

Hubby and I landed here after being poorly treated by a different nearby Italian restaurant. Lucky us. Wonderful service, cozy atmosphere, delicious meals. We shared a salad; I had spaghetti with meatballs (delicious!); hubby had the lamb. We liked it so much that we went back the next evening too. Hubby had the twisted pasta with bolognese (good sauce, he didn't care for that particular pasta); I had the butternut ravioli (a little sweet and savory, very tasty). We're fans!
Came for a Restaurant Week dinner; three courses. The service was decent but the food wasn't great at all. Olive Garden quality is better.
Try the meatballs and butternut squash ravioli, so good. Great atmosphere and excellent service.

To begin with, it has a great environment and it's a really large, spacious restaurant - which can be rare in Manhattan. The food: We had a cheese and meat plate and it was great. I ordered the Daviola Pizza (pepperoni) and the ingredients were incredibly fresh and delicious. The unusual part is that i was with a large group of friends and the waitress came over one time and asked if we were ready to order... we put in the appetizer order... and she never came back. Like ever. We did have a waiter who was filling drinks and super cool guy and really great (a number of us ordered alcoholic beverages)... but after 40 minutes of us talking and carrying on, i asked the male server if I missed the ordering round or something and he said 'no one has ordered anything' .. i assumed he meant they just weren't hungry or something, so i ordered a pizza. When i was eating my pizza, my friends asked me when i ordered... turns out they were still waiting for the server to take their order!! They were starving!! We decided to just pay our bill so far and go elsewhere, where they all were finally able to order and eat! So strange that no one ever came back and asked for orders. Otherwise it was a great restaurant!
NoNo Casa NonnaUsed to be good -chicken parm with a bone ?Zucchini spaghetti huh!Best was desserts Mediocre service
This place was a great late night choice and very close to all of the action if your in midtown. The truffle pizza special was excellent.

Went to Casa Nonna during the holidays with a group of 10. There's an optional coat check and a large bar area for a pre-meal drink. We were seated promptly and it was cozy without being cramped. Our server was attentive and helpful in making selections for both wine and our meals. He made sure our wine glasses were filled regularly, as well as our water. I split the Pansotti di Zucca and Tagliatelle Integrali with my partner, and both were absolutely delicious. The pasta tasted fresh and the ingredients blended well together. We found it wasn't quite enough food so would recommend ordering more than just a pasta per person.
Wonderful from first step inside! Aromas, tastes, service, ambiance!! Great experience for a group! The meatballs!! Swordfish!! Pasta, dessert!! Everything was perfect!

This place was just how I pictured an Italian restaurant in NYC should be. We walk in, checked in with the hostess, and immediately asked if we wanted our coats checked.  Ambiance is very homey and family style restaurant. Tastefully decorated with big comfy couches as part of tables. Service was great. Server was attentative, water filled constantly, and dishes cleared away. We ordered the grilled octopus, frutti de mare, and tagliatelle integrali. The grilled octopus was decent. I wish there was a little more octopus considering the price. Our main dishes were delicious! Homemade pasta really makes a difference. Tiramisu to finish off our meals. It was divine. It even had roasted coffee beans on the side to complement the dish. Yummm..I would come back here!

Delicious authentic Italian for my family of 4. We walked in on a Saturday night a little before 5 and immediately got a table as long as we promised to turn it by 630. No problem, food came right out and we had time for dessert. Exemplary service, highly recommended. Beautiful decor, not stuffy, there were families with well-behaved young kids and by the time we left, the place was packed!

The food was very good. The waiter was not as attentive as we'd like. I usually run out of water, but if my wife does then that means we were not visited in at least 15 minutes. It's on a Monday too, the restaurant wasn't packed.

Ambiance is really nice. Big place and nicely decorated. Had the truffle gnocchi and it was amazing. Melt in your mouth delicious and not overbearing with truffle. Also the Caesar salad and prosciutto pizza were delicious. I'll be back!

A very nice serendipitous find in the Garment District. They definitely have curb appeal!We happened by and it caught our eye. Nice, upscale place with a warm, inviting vibe inside. We sat at the bar and enjoyed the Diavola pizza -- pepperoni, tomato, basil, and mozzarella. Delicious! A really tasty New York treat.Bartender was great, very friendly, and quick with the pours. Very happy to have come across Casa Nonna.
Great place near Penn Station. Very cool old world Art Deco vibe to the restaurant. Food and drinks do not disappoint. Chicken parm is excellent as are the scallops with risotto.

This was a little hidden gem just around the corner from our hotel. We didn't notice it until the last day in NYC but so happy we found it! Our food was absolutely delicious. My son had spaghetti and meatballs, my little 3 year old had the macaroni and cheese, some of the best I've ever had, I had their Salmon special with truffle butter and that was melt in your mouth delicious! I could've had another plate, it was that good. A little pricey for taking kids to lunch but totally worth it!
We had a wonderful experience at Casa Nonna. The food was amazing and we loved our server Massi. A great find, a walk away from Penn Station. Will definitely be returning!
Great! I am vegan and they were accommodating. Vegan pizza. They said the chef could also make a vegan plate for 25.00.
I brought customers here for dinner. The atmosphere was perfect for a business meal. Food was good and prices were appropriate for the area. I would definitely go back.
Lovely open space and Decor. portions were on the small side and average in taste. good for a quick meal without the wait

Loved everything about this place. The food, the vibe, the wine. La Casa Nonna impressed me. Next time I'm in NYC, I would love to come back. The staff was friendly and efficient. The restaurant was cozy, clean and everyone was extremely accommodating.

Met an old friend who was staying around the corner and is a simple eater. Upscale Italian seemed perfect. The restaurant is beautiful and the FOH staff were polite. Service was slow and odd. Beautiful looking pizzas were coming out of the kitchen. But wasn't on the menu. I asked the server, who replied, oh I'll bring the pizza menu (we had the special, dinner and cocktail menus upon seating). My guest ordered a repeat of her first beer, was brought a different one, when we asked to switch it, the waiter said, no, i think this was it, are you sure? Yes, She was aware of the beverage she was drinking. Drinks came out after starters, and water glasses sat empty. Our servers switched at dessert and pick up server was sweet. The Caesar was perfunctory. My much anticipated asparagus, poached egg with truffles starter  (from the truffle prix fixe menu - a nice touch that the items were also a la carte) was...ok. The egg was not warm, nor was the accompanying sauce - my preference with any runny egg is warm.  The asparagus had great snap. The duck pappardelle was greasy and already cool on the outside -  though the pasta itself was lovely. My guest seemed to enjoy her pomodoro. The chocolate torte was a brick of cloying sweetness.  She got through 2 bites. I should have ordered differently. The Brussels sprouts or spinach sides sounded lovely and pizzas did look beautiful.I didn't say anything to the mgt as I was with an old friend and didn't want to cloud our time together. I still tipped above average - because serving is someone's livelihood - but I just wouldn't recommend overall.

Had dinner here with a colleague on a Tuesday evening.  I enjoyed the butternut squash ravioli... it was so delicious.  And then, enjoyed their rice pudding dessert plus a glass of port. I was very happy with their willingness to modify the rice pudding (normally served with fresh bananas) by removing the bananas, as I have a banana allergy.Definitely worth a try!

I had lunch with 2 colleagues at Casa Nonna.  Overall, we had a great experience.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere is very nice.  Prices are reasonable and portions are good.  Two of us shared a pizza and one person had a panini.  Our only complaint was the very friendly waiter was also VERY SLOW.  Lunch lasted nearly 2 hours and we only had main courses - no appetizers or dessert.  It would seem staff and servers should be cognizant that some people are there on their lunch break.  We were initially seated without menus and had to wait for the waiter to bring them.  He served our drinks and had to come back to take our order.  And so it went throughout lunch.  Even when we spoke up to ask for the check, there was still a long delay.  I would definitely go back again, but would hope we had a different server!

Went here before Elton John concert at MSG.  ARRIVED AT 6:30 due to horrendous traffic and had called to let them know.  Upon arrival immediately told hostess (manager) that we had concert at 8.  Response was "everyone here is going."  Ordered bottle of wine and then food by 6:45.  Salads came quickly, but main dishes did not follow.  Constantly reminded server of time frame.  Was told "they're working on it now."  Server asked it we wanted to talk with manager and I said yes.  Manager arrived ten minutes later, after food arrived (50 minutes after ordering).  Rushed down dinner.  After explaining situation, her only answer was "thanks for coming", three or four times.  Needless to say, we were late for Sir Elton, luckily only a few minutes.  Food was fair to good, but wife's Frutta de Mar had little seafood, mostly pasta and my chicken parm was fair.  Poorly handled from beginning to end. I would have appreciated being told they might not be able to get us out in time (giving us the opportunity to leave and get a quick bite elsewhere and they had people waiting for tables) to an apology and even the manager's card and an offer of a drink the next time we came.  Will NEVER return.

Cheeses were $10 each and served at less than an ounce per. Not worth the order at all. Not even a little bit. Skip it and eat something real for the price. The Neapolitan Pizza had a perfectly oiled crust with sweet crushed tomatoes in place of sauce. Foldable and delish. Huge space, solid service, positive experience. Won't set out to visit again, but if I'm in the hood, for sure.

Definitely trust your Italian coworker on nearby Italian eats! I went with colleagues to this restaurant after a long day of work and it was splendid! Staff were very polite, the restaurant is warm and welcoming and of course, food and wine were great! I can only comment on what I ordered: the siamese agnolotti and Bruschetta! Frankly, best pasta I've had outside of homemade! My only complaint? NOT ENOUGH OF IT. My colleagues also got other pasta dishes and their portions did seem larger, but not too shabby. Next time I'm in New York, I'll definitely be back!

From start to finish we were impressed. Atmosphere was nice; as the restaurant filled up you could here the noise level rise as you would expect. Staff was very attentive. Recommend you use reservations; especially if you are going to a show or MSG. After 6 we noticed it was taking longer for food to come out to the other tables.

Service staff is super friendly n knowledgeable. Food is delish. Nice portions. I had frutti di mare pasta. The sea food was fresh. It could have used more sauce. The fried calamari was a little greasy. They have happy hour by the bar.

Business lunch today.  5-star all the way.  Service: fine.  Atmosphere: delightful.  Food/Drink:  Outstanding.  1) Excellent Old Fashioned.   2) Out-of-this-World Chicken Parm (2nd best I've had in the City), 3) Great Tiramisu.   Could not ask for anything more and easily better than the last 20 biz lunches I've had recently.

Large Italian restaurant located between Penn Station and Port Authority two main transportation hubs in the city. Ideal location for meeting someone traveling to or from outside the city! The interior decor and atmosphere make you feel like your in a villa is Italy. The smell of fresh homemade pizza when you walk in takes your breath away. Grab a seat at the bar if your waiting for the rest of your party or get seated right away and order a glass of wine! Take your time as you look over the extensive menu before making your choice. We shared two pizzas for two people and that was just right. We had the Margherita and the Parma and both were made to perfection. The staff was very friendly treating everyone like a local who comes here often, even if it was your first time. It's a large restaurant so I'm not sure you would have to make a reservation but I would highly recommend stopping in one day soo !

They have great meatballs and calamari, there beet salad is delicious. Gnocchi and other pasta dishes were spot on. Service was good even on a busy Saturday night. Finish with a chocolate tart although very decadent and rich (as expected) its worth the extra calories.

This place is ok. I think my expectations were too high. I am used to trying amazing restaurants and thought since we are in New York this place will be outstanding. Food was fine but don't order the bruschetta. That was terrible. Cocktails are expensive and they are nothing special. If you only have a few days in NY, skip this place.
This was a great suggestion from our hotel! The ambiance was great. We had really good food and wine. The service was good and very attentive even though it became very busy as time went on.

Very nice Italian restaurant in mid-town New York; clean, open layout and a welcoming hostess. The design is primarily hard woods and floors, which results in a very noisy environment when busy. The house-made burrata caprese salad was terrific, and the pasta Bolognese was tasty, but the pasta was a bit overcooked. The service was efficient, but my waitress was "brusque" for the most part. Nonetheless, I would recommend this restaurant when in midtown.
Came in for happy hour + dinner. Ordered the calamari (delicious), Bellini, pizza, Caesar salad. All were delicious. Highly recommend.

I was disappointed after reading some of the reviews extolling the place.  Of course, I was also flabbergasted by Ni Y's review as one of the worst steakhouses.  Maybe he had too much to drink as this is an Italian restaurant.  It's good but not very good.  It was mostly empty on a Saturday night.  I wouldn't recommend it.

I just had an amazing meal at this place with my girlfriends. The space is impressive, tall ceilings, room for  large groups and still manages to feel warm and intimate.  The food is delicious and served in a very appetizing manner.   The servers are very helpful and friendly.  I really am going to come back and suggest this place for my large work parties and anyone I need to impress :-).

First time here my coworker recommended this place to me. The reason why I am giving them 3 stars is basically because is an average Italian restaurant. Food and drinks were ok but prices were way too expensive, for 4 people that only ate pizza and appetizers plus 3 drinks  the bill was  $150. as you can see our table and the food nothing fancy.. make sure you bring enough cash  for your visit

Went on Saturday evening at 9.15, was quiet and service was quick. I have a theory that if the bread is excellent then the food is excellent, make the effort on the simple stuff  turns into making a bigger effort for reason people come ... the foodIt was outstanding, the roasted beet salad was to die for. Pork saltimbocca was amazing and had a chocolate mouse made from olive oil and wow. So thoroughly recommend it

One of my favorite spots in the city. Huge area so you really get comfy seating and privacy (very rare in Manhattan). Decor is like a large library - works for business dinners, family dinners and date night.As for the food, eggplant parm is incredible, pizzas are excellent,  most pasta dishes are great. I wasn't as impressed with the meats, but then again, it's an Italian restaurant not a steakhouse.Bar area is great for a quick bite. Many customers are regulars, as I used to be when I lived in the area. I still go back from time to time, for the eggplant parm.

Just came here for lunch to try out the restaurant week menu. I loved everything about the place - the ambience, the waiters and the food. It was our first time here so we ordered out of the restaurant week menu. I had the chilled pea soup, grilled salmon and tiramisu. It was cool that they offered desserts for an additional $5 as part of their restaurant week menu. The pea soup was good but personally I prefer my soup hot and so the chilled soup didnt work well with me. If you like chilled soup then you'll like this one. The grilled salmon was amazing. It was cooked perfectly and was extremely flavorful. My friend had the chicken and I could tell it was cooked perfect. The tiramisu was okay not the best I had though. The waiters and the host were friendly and accommodating. The restaurant is huge and beautiful. I'll definitely come here again.

Went there for a date night. Food was good. Waitstaff attentive. Portions small. The seating set up for a two person table was pretty bizarre, we werent sitting across from eachother or next to eachother, sort of at a weird angle. Place was pretty dead for a saturday night, plenty of open tables which made me wonder why they wanted me to reserve a spot so badly. The experience was overall good. A little more expensive than most but i paid less than i expected after reading other reviews

Great place and atmosphere. From the appetizers to the entrée all were delicious. The burrata, eggplant ,parma & salami board ,gnocchi and meatballs were great. Service was also fine. Will be sure to be back.... Sambuca and espresso sealed it

Great place to go for some really good Italian food. We went there for restaurant week during lunch and they had some really good options. Most of our table ordered the salmon which was a good portion size. The salmon was really tasty but the quinoa salad that came with it was a little bland. The watermelon salad though was super yummy (red and yellow watermelon with procuitto). The service was pretty slow which was the only big complain. So if you have time to sit there with a group for lunch then it's great but if you don't have longer than 1 hour then it may not be the best spot for lunch.

This was one of the worst steakhouses that I've been to. The service is really poor. They have me medium when I asked for medium rare on my steak. Actually, they didn't even know what medium looked like, had to go back and ask someone else. After realizing they messed up, they made no offer to fix the dish, they just stood there looking sad until I said it was okay.The food is nothing special, the sirloin was dry and tasteless and the mango puree reminded me of a McDonald's slushy, overtly tangy and sweet. My friend had a "warm chocolate pudding cake" aka a sad looking lava cake. The chilled pea soup was pretty good though, I'll give them that.
Miserable experience Food was overpriced and the portions were smallService was not goodExtremely overpriced for what you got there has to be a better choices in New York

Food was awesome! Chicken parm was super tender and a decent size portion. Gnocchi was also delicious! Nice atmosphere and staff was superb! Will definitely be returning and would recommend for anyone looking for a fantastic Italian Restaurant in NYC.
We went here for my bday dinner. Amazing food and service. We had a lot of fun. They have a cute romantic ambience. And the food comes out fresh and delicious. Would definitely come back here.

Just finished food at Casa Nonna with my colleague for a business meeting and the food was great. Service over all is nice.I had one problem which is the lobster pasta I ordered was way too spicy and I was drinking a lot of water. Service wise the waiter kind of rush taking away my plate. Our conversation were interrupted too many times but overall I would recommend for friends to come.

Wonderful experience again. This time we took my youngest grandson for a birthday dinner. The staff and especially Alexandra ( who was our server on a previous visit ) is top notch. Highly recommended!

Hostess was pleasant and welcoming! Food and atmosphere were great! I ordered the Mediterranean Sea Bass which had a nice balanced flavor...I loved the white beans with the dish! The restaurant was on the loud side but still able to clearly hear conversation within our table. The Torta Di Chocolato was excellent...be sure to end the meal with it!

Came here for lunch with coworkers to celebrate. It's a beautiful space with lots of seating. It wasn't a particularly busy and we were sat right away without a reservation. The service was great and the wait staff was all very attentive. We all ordered wine and water and our drinks were brought very quickly. I ordered the Frutti di Mare which was okay, nothing to write home about. A few of my coworkers got pizzas and they looked (and smelled) amazing. The food was good and we had a great time that was enhanced and never interrupted by the service.

I came here for my mom's birthday at 5pm on a Saturday before seeing a Broadway show and we could not have had a better experience! The location is in the Theatre District, but tucked away from the crowds of Times Square.We made a reservation a few days before, and the day of they called to confirm, which I always appreciate. They also asked if there was any occasion, and I said it was a birthday.When we arrived, I was pleased with the space, high ceilings, tables spaced nicely, not too noisy. Our party of six was seated at a comfortable circular booth.Everyone raved about the food (I had the chicken parm which was amazing) and the service was even better. At the end of the meal, our server surprised us all by bringing over a birthday cake as well as a bottle of Prosecco for all of us to share, on the house! (no singing though, which my mom appreciated)We'll definitely be returning for events in the future!

My family and I came here for dinner for the first time after seeing Hello, Dolly! on broadway, and we are definitely coming back! The food was amazing, the staff was lovely, and the bathrooms were clean! And the atmosphere is so homey and welcoming but so nice at the same time. I highly recommend the grilled octopus and they had an amazing truffle pizza special when we came. I can't wait to come back after our next broadway show.

In NYC for the weekend for a few shows and foolishly did not have a reservation. Read other reviews and was very, very lucky to to get in for a 5:15pm reservation.  Outstanding!!  One of the best dinners we have had in a long time.  Had the bruschetta selection, the veal saltembuca and pasta Ragu.   All were very good.  The veal tenderloin wrapped in prosciutto with risotto was an incredible mixture of heavenly tastes. It really was that good.  My wife ordered and I ate half of it!!   And as everyone says, the service was top notch.  A perfect level of attention.  I had a few mins to share our experience with the general manager too.  I will be back !!
Rack of lamb superb. The steak tartare is good, the portion is very big for an appetizer. Great ambiance and friendly attentive service
Great food. Very authentic. Good portions. Very good service. Outside seating. Shared a Caesar salad was plenty to share between two as a starter to the food. I'm visiting but would come back again.

I am a big fan of this place.  I return often, including important business/client meetings.  This place never fails me - food is great, service is great, decent wine list, imaginative menu, great convenient location and affordable prices.  I even love the atmosphere.  No matter how big my party, a large group or a private dinner for two, this place never disappoints.  (Although I am sad they changed the menu - I LOVE THOSE BRUSSEL SPROUTS!!) They also have a few private rooms, if needed.I am a happy returning patron!!!  And I will be back again soon.
$15 for a half a drink; mushy a$$ pasta; terrible service. I didn't even see a server to ask for non mushy pasta so I dealt w it. Puts Nonna' name to shame. I was super disappointed all around.

My daughter and I came here for a combo birthday and mother's day celebration. It's a tad pricey but nothing too outrageous. My veal medallions wrapped in prosciutto were delicious. My daughter loved her pasta and seafood. Wine and dessert were great. Would go back for a special occasion.
All I have to say is WOW!!Great service Great and amazing food!!Great pastries!!Great place and the pasta is amazing!!The best place to eat Italian food in New York!!Thank you   :)
user_loc: Lower Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA

text: The food has always been great! The feel is comfortable and menu just large enough to be good and not over powering. Great spot for eating prior to a show.

Good ambience, great food and excellent service. Came with a group of 6, we each ordered cocktails and they were all heavenly. We shared a cheese and meat platter- which was delish, came with toasted bread (which they were gracious about giving extras of). Next we each ordered a pasta dish, I don't remember what everyone had but I took a bite of each and they were all really good. I had the gnocchi and it was my personal favorite of the night. If you love garlic and truffle, then this is the dish for you! Everything about this restaurant is 5 stars!

Fantastic dinner at Casa Nonna last night! The homemade burrata with the Tuscan bread and roasted peppers was a great way to start the meal. The Halibut was one of the best I have ever had -- Perfectly cooked -- on top of a flavorful white asparagus! A side of potatoes made my meal complete.  My friend had an absolutely gorgeous pasta dish with seafood as the entree. Plus, the staff was super-friendly and checked on us frequently.  All around an A+!!!
Great place. Out with Friends. Service is great here and don't forget about the incredible drinks:) ask for Steven at the ber

Came in for lunch on a Friday around 12:30 and was seated immediately. Very large inside and the decor was rustic and fun. Service was fantastic! The food was mediocre. Complementary crisp bread on the table was delicious. My sister got a panini which was more a toasted bread cold sandwich. I chose the Margherita Pizza and it was mediocre. Overall - fantastic service but just okay food.

We recently made reservations to try Casa Nonna in NYC for a birthday celebration.  After reading some reviews and reviewing the menu we decided to give it a try but not before calling to ask a few questions about the menu options.  When we got to the restaurant we quickly learned that all of the information that we got over the phone was incorrect concerning menu options and their posted happy hour specials.  We decided to ask to speak with a manager... BIG MISTAKE!  The restaurant's beverage manager was extremely rude to us all, spoke to us in an unprofessional manner when we were trying to explain the information that his staff not only gave us over the phone, but also when we were seated at our table, and simply made everyone feel so uncomfortable that we decided to leave.  To make matters worse, when I ask about his role at the restaurant he first portrayed himself as THE manager only to find out after he was the beverage manager.  This is when I decided on our way out that it was important to tell the general manager what had just transpired.  She was apologetic but at not point was she resolving the problem, nor taking any responsibility for the beverage manager's behavior.  The good news... there is an amazing restaurant around the corner called Tavola that we went to instead that had fantastic food, the service was outstanding, atmosphere bright and lively and even with a packed house they squeezed us in.  Some things i guess are meant to be!

This is a fancy Italian restaurant,But its worth it. Excellent service, good food, drink.Things i like in here are ;tables are big, you're not squizing the water, cocktail, food, phone on tiny tables.Ambience excellent.Food very good. They gave flat bread to start, which is very yummy. Anddd, if you're allergic to cheese, you can ask bread without cheese..Very comfortable sofa (we got booth).They even have private rooms. Excellent.
Very good brick oven pizza's, good salads, nice wine menu, good home style Italian fanfare. Very nice atmosphere, great service, good food.

A "meh" dining experience.The service here is fine. The decor is nice in a Jersey-style money spending sort of way. The food is mediocre. You walk in and find a very spacious, dimly lit, well decorated restaurant. The hostess seats you immediately because there is never a wait. Service is prompt.I think maybe if you've never had Italian food before, or think Jersey Italian food is all there is (or is what you want), then maybe you'd like this place's food. The food is, however, the same quality you can get at a diner for half the price. So, if you'd like to pay for the better service & nice decor to get diner food, then this is your spot!
One of the best Italian restaurants in NYC.  We are so lucky to live super close to it.  You got to try the butternut squash ravioli, veal, and meatballs, so good!

Terrible hostess. I don't understand why a professional restaurant has rude incompetent hostesses. It certainly doesn't add up to an enjoyable evening.  Food is ok nothing more. Entire restaurant seems manufactured.

The environment is good for business dinner and conveniently located in the theater district. The food is so soFor appetizer, the grilled octopus is really good, the octopus is chewy and flavourful. The calamari is so so, a bit too much batter for my taste.. We ordered 5 pastas to share, they are ok, liked the al dente texture.The sea bass entrée is good, the fish itself has a crispy skin on the outside and the meat is tender. The prosciutto wrapped veal is so so, the mushroom was a bit too salty.Desserts are fine.

Went today with my friend for a restaurant week dinner. Was very impressed with food, both- taste and decor. Pleasant staff, enough space, no rush. Will definitely go back and recommend it to my friends.

Visited last night for the first time with my friend. We sat at the bar for several hours and had a fabulous time! Kevin, the bartender took excellent care of us. The drinks were delicious! We also ordered a few appetizers to share, all were great. We definitely plan on coming back!

This restaurant really fell off.   I had ordered lunch and the Chicken parmesan taste like it was a reheated left-over (like 2-weeks of refrigerator burn).  Very disappointed and I will never return to this establishment again.

Food was good service was ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC Scott was the worst didn't check on me once had to ask three times for bread that I asked for as soon as I sat down didn't come until my main was almost finished Food was excellent but the service didn't make me feel 50 bucks was worth a salad and ravioli

Ideally, I'd like to give this place 3 1/2 stars but because I can't, I'll have to go with lower end of the spectrum. Came here for a work lunch on a Tuesday and the crowd was as expected, not too busy, but still a nice rush. The best place is spacious and tastefully decorated. We ordered fried calamar for the table and burrata, unfortunately the calamari never made it to our table as the waiter forgot. For entrees our table ordered their brick over pizza, a couple paninis, the seafood pasta, gnocchi and I ordered the crab cakes salad. The waiter warned me the crab cakes were small and recommended I'd get a soup which I did. I also asked him if it was over a salad and he said yes. I had the butternut squash soup which was very tasty, but once my crab cakes came out even though extremely tasty, they were the size of quarters and came with NO salad except for arugula as a garnish. Luckily I wasn't too hungry so it sufficed but nevertheless was a little disappointed. I would still however give this place another shot and wouldn't divert anyone from trying it.

DO NOT PASS UP ON THIS PLACE. My wife and I have eaten here 4 times and it has become our go to each time we come into the city. We recommend this place to any family and friends that come in as well. We just recently celebrated our 5th anniversary here and again they never cease to amaze. The service is amazing and the people are great. Any one of their pastas are the way to go. And the calamari is great. I wish I could give them 6 stars.

I don't post reviews that much, but the type of service I was provided at this place left my stomach empty literally. I walked into the place and not once I was acknowledge by the bar tender. 3 men walked after me and he focus his attention on them. I am left sitting and waiting, by the time he gives me the menus the 3 gentleman already have drinks on their hands. The bartender asks me what am I doing there. I told him I am eating lunch. The manager came to me apologized, but instead she decided to treat me like I was not sure of what I ordered. The manager asked me the same question 3 times and 3 times o told her that I ordered the meatball and pomodoro pasta. While I was being asked the same question 3 times I mentioned that why would a person that is highly allergic to calamari, order calamari and she said that the bartender misunderstood. The word calamari and pomodoro are different and there is no way it can be confused. Meanwhile bartender The manager said fine with an attitude agains making it look like it was my fault. Management is terrible, in this place the customer is always at fault.Thanks to this experience I will be taking this place out my list of places where I will be booking business dinners and future company events for 2018.
Very good, tasty selections. Nice wine list and really fabulous bread. I enjoyed my salad and the appetizers were light and enjoyable.
Amazing... just delicious! Bruschetta app and pumpkin squash raviolis... by partner had a beef and pork ragu over a ribbon pasta, also delicious.
Great pizza & homemade pasta. Meatball appetizer is a good starter. Located just south of all the holiday shopping, more locals than tourists on a Tuesday night.

This place is awesome. A little pricey, but this is manhattan and the restaurant is on the nicer side. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I love the zoodle choice of a side dish. Portions aren't huge, it's a good size.

This restaurant has the most amazing food and the best service we have had so far.  The spaghetti pomodoro was fresh and the  pasta was cooked perfectly.  The meatballs were melt in your mouth tender.  The flatbread was tasty and fresh.  Your water glass never got below a 1/4.  Try the cheese cake.  It was flavorful, fresh and a very well put together taste.  Will come again next time we are in town.

Snuck us in with a late reservation right at opening.  The service the entire time was great.  All enjoyed his calamari appetizer and wine.  Scallops and papperadili were amazing.  Great atmosphere and can't beat the price.

Found Casa Nonna on Yelp and was totally pleased with the excellent food, friendly service and cozy atmosphere.   Chef/owner stopped by to chat; lov that this a longtime family business.  Great menu and reasonable prices.

The 411 @ Casa Nonna The Atmosphere/Decor....Vast space, high ceilings, walls top to bottom lined with paintings, round tables and leather wrap around seating and loud lively family atmosphereThe Service...Was phenomenal. Our server Heriberto was incredibly spot on, conscious of our 8pm show and was very attentive and helpful.The Italian Food...Excellent. My husband and I got the Margarita Pizza to share ($12) 2 large slices each and the talk of the town was my Pici Pasta in Ragu Sauce ($25). My husbands Gnocchi was delicious but a little on the smaller portion side and the Pici really was the all star dish. For Dessert, we shared the Torta Di Cioccato ($12) super decadent.Really such a great place in the Garment District. Perfect before a show and packed at 6pm on Saturday night!
Made reservations last minute and Casa Nonna was able to accommodate us. Nice atmosphere and plenty of space. Drinks were good. Food was lackluster.

Always a wonderful time here. It's our go to place whenever we are at an event at the Javits Center. The food is perfectly prepared. The drinks are creative and tasty and the service is outstanding. The bar scene for happy hour is a great way to unwind before dinner. Our waiter Leo knew the menu inside and out. He answered questions on flavors and textures in all the dishes we ordered and was right on the money with each one.

Cosa Nonna is a fabulous place to come to if you want amazing Italian food! Not to mention delicious drinks.I started off having a Bellini. It had a good balance of peaches and champagne. For my main course I had the chicken parm with zucchini pasta and man oh man I totally enjoyed that. Chicken was good perfect, sauce was flavorful and my zucchini pasta was cooked just right and a very light butter sauce. For dessert, we had the chocolate cake which was rich, but not too rich were you wanting glass of milk along with ice cream on the side. It balanced the chocolate cake just right. Supper yummy! Totally will be back!

Pleasantly surprised by some of the dishes at Casa Nonna. We went at an off hour so we had to sit in the bar area at a high top.  We were greeted relatively quickly, however most of the tables around us were dirty, which was odd seeming as how there were no patrons. At any rate, we had the roasted peach salad to start and they serve it with a warm, spicy flatbread. Those were quite good as was the salad. For entrees we shared the cheese-filled beet tortellini in a hazelnut brown butter sauce and the farfalle pasta prepared with spring veggies in a cream sauce. Additionally, we shared a side of eggplant parm.  Out of all the dishes, the ricotta and beet tortellini was by far the tastiest. The farfalle was a little to rich and oily for my liking. The eggplant parm was also a little too oily. As far as taste goes, it was alright, but the greasiness aspect of the dish coupled with the cheese layers in proportion to actual eggplant was a little overwhelming.  I did enjoy it overall thou and would give it another go with some of the other offerings. However, I would not recommend going in between lunch and dinner because we had no service, the bartender changed over without letting us know, and the new one never came to check on us.
5 stars all the way.  Recommend call and reserve a table.  The service was impeccable the food was fantastic, the wine was amazing.  A jewel of Italian food in NYC.  Go here if you are in the area.

I was in NY for business and my boss recommended this place for dinner. So happy I tried it because it was delicious. I'm giving it four stars for these reasons, 1 star for polite and great service, 1 star for the amazing chicken parm with zucchini spaghetti, 1 star for the even more phenomenal tiramsu, and  1 star for decent prices. The one problem I had was my macchiato with dessert, it was just plain bad. Not a defining factor but I was looking forward to a good cup of coffee and I was disappointed. Overall it was a great meal and would love to come back again!!

It's a decent restaurant in time square area. We had a ragu pasta, branzino, and a side dish of brussels sprouts. Food was good but felt they were overpriced. Atmosphere is spacious and relaxing. It feels like an Italian restaurant in the suburbs. Good spot for a family dinner.
Not bad for the area. In the desolate commercial desert between Port Authority and Penn Station, options are limited. This spot certainly won't wow you, but everything I have had is solid.

This was a great surprise! Just stopped in and had wonderful service and an amazing pasta dish that was like nothing I had ever tried before.  Traveling solo on business so I sat at the bar.  The bartender was attentive and made a great recommendation.  Seriously, the Barbabietole e Tortellini Ricotta was OUTSTANDING!  Beet and ricotta tortellini with brown butter hazelnut pesto and arugula was just spot on! Definitely will remember this meal.  This place also has great atmosphere and was full.  Always a good sign.  Hope to come back and try other dishes as well.  Very enjoyable!

I was absolutely blown away by the dinner I had here recently. It's a simple menu, and judging by the reaction of everyone at my party you can't go wrong with anything you order. First off: the bread they bring for the table is amazing. I don't want to spoil it for you, but it involves cheese. I always feel guilty eating octopus because they're so smart and cool, but my guilt was quickly forgotten when I had the Polipo-just a phenomenal medley of flavors. Next you're going to want to snag the gnocchi. It's like eating tiny pillows of deliciousness. Somehow they melt in your mouth. I don't know how it's possible. The Frutti Di Mare is not only fun to say while gesticulating, but it's also incredibly delicious.  If you skip dessert here you should be ashamed of yourself. Come on! You just had a great meal and you think they're not gonna knock your socks off with dessert??! Well hold on to your socks because dessert is the real deal. Get the Torta Di Cioccolato. Just do it. The presentation of all the dishes was, as those darn millennials say, "Instagram Worthy" you could easily pop any of the dishes up on the 'Gram and rake in likes.

Went for happy hour - when they have some solid drink prices.  Drinks were basic but good, wine was eh but all good for happy hour.You can tell this place is owned by a restaurant group and they are trying so hard to look italian.The staff seemed better suited for Applebee's than a 'nice' restaurant.  They were sneaking each other drinks during their shift.  Not the worst thing in the world but definately overall just an Applebee's vibe.The big problem was the mozzarella.  Boy was it bad.  I eat a lot (read: too much) mozzarella and this was the worst I've had in a long time.  Tasteless would be an upgrade.Frankly if they can't get the mozzarella right I don't want to try the rest of the food.  Hard to find a decent happy hour drink menu in the area though so I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt and say if you don't eat there -- 3 stars.  Eat there at your own risk.

Average+Friendly staffCool atmosphereThe steak was good (so was the sauce)-Cocktails were the kind you can make yourself at home in 1 minute, except they cost 15$ and didn't taste muchRest of the food was bland to averageTiny portionsDisappointed
Food was good but I was expecting a bit more for the price. The minimal service from an unfriendly waitress made this meal not as enjoyable as it could have been.

So I went here for lunch, and Annie, the general manager, came and sat with me and chatted and made sure I felt comfortable.  The staff is so friendly and warm.  The service is fast, and the food is to die for!  I had the gnocchi.  AMAZING!  I also met a nice man there.  We went on a date.  This restaurant is warm, cozy and decently priced.  I highly recommend it.

What can I say? Such a great restaurant! We found this restaurant on accident while walking around Midtown. Love the decor. Love the food. Loved our waiter (wish I could remember his name). Get the beet tortellini! You won't regret it!

Casa Nonna is a dark, handsome space with big round tables that work well for big groups.  The decor is reminiscent of Carmine's.  The waitstaff were very nice and the service was good.   We were comped some delicious, freshly baked foccacia to start.  The red wine was warm, one of my pet peeves.  We started with two good pizzas, the Bosca and the Emilia.  The pizzas are small, but make great appetizers.  They usually come cut into four slices.  Cutting them into eight slices works well.  The entrees were lackluster.  My wife had the branzino, which she didn't love.  I had pici with ragu. It was very run of the mill.  It was a friend's birthday.  We brought a cake.  The restaurant charged $5 per person to plate and serve the cake.  They served it with a scoop of ice cream.  Fair enough. The waitress brought out a plate of mini blondies to end the meal.The one bad thing about the evening was that the restaurant was uncomfortably hot.  We went with friends who had been here multiple times and raved about it.   We didn't want to offend our friends and waited for them to bring the issue up.  This didn't happen until late in the meal.  When we asked the waitress about it, she said that part of it was the pizza oven and part of it was the air conditioning.  She said that she would appreciate it if we mentioned it to the manager.  This indicates that it's an ongoing issue.  So while this restaurant is OK overall, I wouldn't recommend it for anything other than a winter meal.  Too bad...
Surprisingly great place to eat! Lively atmosphere and very good food. The starter plate to share was very nice, and the food was really tasty! Friendly staff!

Today at Casa Nona, me and my son had a very nice dinner! The building and structure of the place was very well captured! The food was astonishingly amazing! My son had ordered a delicious pepperoni  pizza. He said " If i were a man who worked here, I'd be proud of my work!" Definitely a place for people who love pizza! #CasaNonna!

So good! Best meal we've had in New York. So glad we decided to try this place out. Very welcoming from the great staff, the incredible aroma and the food was tens across the board. I will definitely becoming back and telling all my friends about it.

Surprisingly huge inside! Spacious without seeming like you could get lost inside. The decor is warm and inviting. Service is great and the staff is accommodating to bossypants requests like mine. Currently finishing up the Whole30, but loving food as I do, I still wanted to indulge! I had the spaghetti squash with olive oil only instead of the delicious sounding truffle butter. I also had the potatoes.... both were great! Service was wonderful as well. I'd definitely venture here again if I was in the area!

Exceptional flavors. Decor is modern with a nod to old school Italian NY. The portions are small for the price and no extras like bread etc. the desserts are tasty but also small. This is a corporate concept and it needs attention. The price point value isn't there. I'd move on down the street.

Perhaps it is the location at the base of a large luxury apartment building or the over-sized tables, ideal for business dining, but it is difficult to ignore the somewhat "corporate" vibe here, owned by large hospitality chain E Squared (in the press recently for a spat with founder of By Chloe).  However, a lovely space with many tables and seemingly not so crowded does allow for a peaceful evening. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and as attentive as possible, and while the food did take a bit of time, it is nice to be able to enjoy a slower-paced meal.  They have a very extensive wine and cocktail list, including the one that struck me, the Man with a Yellow Tie, a wonderful cognac-rye based drink that I could drink all night long. We started with salads, which were perfectly summer-y but nothing to write home about, and calamari, which was served with a to-die-for lemon aioli. For entrees, we went with the sea scallops, which were also top notch and the Siamese Agnolotti, small dual ravioli, which were tasty, but as often can happen with smaller sized ravioli, didn't allow the taste of the stuffing to overcome the pasta itself. We couldn't resist the dessert menu either, which featured one of the finest ricotta cheesecakes I've ever had. Overall, the portions were a bit small for the price, not particularly surprising for a restaurant of this caliber (quality over quantity) and the corporate feel is a bit hard to break through, but the food speaks for itself and does quite well.
I enjoyed my experience here tonight.  Service was attentive, and the food was very delicious.

My appetite was ruined by one very smelly clam and sands in three mussels. They were not many in the first place. And there were chilly pepper seeds which surprised me not in a cheerful way... The sauce and pancakes are fine.

Excellent food and ambiance. . . and amazing hospitality and service. Linda and Susan made our party of four feel very special! It was our friend's birthday, and he said that he felt that they knew him. Thank you for being a class business!

I reviewed this back in 2014. Pretty good review. Just had a Barata and peppers app. I like it... nice. Unfortunately I also offer a pepperoni pizza. Terrible... soggy . Downgrading from 4 to 3. .. still like the bar for a drink..

I decided to meet my friend visiting from Canada at this restaurant because it had decent reviews on various apps. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and ambiance of the restaurant. It was dimly lit but not too dark and would be a great spot for either a date spot or business meetings. After being seated, we had to wait quite a while before the waiter showed up to our table to even take our orders. I understand it was a busy night, but I was pretty frustrated with how long it took for them to come around. We ordered calamari fritti for appetizer to share, pici alla toscana for me and my friend got barbabietole e tortellini ricotta. Calamari fritti: honestly the best dish out of the three we ordered. Not only were the serving size pretty decent, but it also had other food fried alongside with the calamari (like squash and green/red peppers) which I quite enjoyed. The sauce that came with it was also pretty good. Pici alla Toscana: I was pretty disappointed with my pasta. The dish was bland and nothing was really unique about the dish. Barbabietole e Tortellini Ricotta: my friend got this dish because the waiter recommended it and it turned out pretty good. The tortellini had hazelnuts in them which added a unique flavor and the spread of fresh arugula definitely went together very well. Maybe I didn't order the right dish but for the price of the pasta, it was disappointing.

Underwhelming is probably the best word to describe my experience here. Not bad. Just underwhelming. The food was okay. The service was fine. The meal was expensive. There was nothing that stood out. My husband and I actually swapped dishes because I could tell he really didn't enjoy what he had ordered. It was very bland, though it wasn't bad. The appetizers we ordered were good. But the entrees on the whole left me wishing we had gone somewhere else. There are a lot of options in the city; however, this won't be one on my list going forward. But you are still welcome to try it. The atmosphere is nice. And if you have money to spend, go for it.

Very spacious restaurant with an intimate vibe. The friend and I started off with a cheese plate paired with an amazing Pinot. I ordered the spaghetti dish and it was so fresh and al dente. The service was very attentive and I had a pleasant time.

Came here for like an office type dinner and it's a great atmosphere for that. Great service, dimly lit... but not too dimly lit and a menu that's interesting but not intimidatingly so. I really enjoyed the siamese agnolottti which is kind of like a ravioli with two distinct pods. Sort of like a ravioli going through mitosis. Anyways, one pod of it had veal and the other was a spinach and cheese and it was excellent. We also split a cheese plate, two bottles of wine, and a side of sprouts. Oh and this place would be good for any meal just generally but sometimes it can be hard to pick a place to eat that's not like a steakhouse or something.
The dinner I had here was to die for. The wine list is great my server was attentive and accommodating and my dessert was delicious. Definitely going back
Great meatballs, flatbed and spinach. Eat in bar for relaxed atmosphere. Wait staff friendly, but professional.

Excellent food, service, and ambiance. We had  a party of 8 and enjoyed every dish that was ordered. The location is only a short walk from Penn station, and has private party room, large dining hall as well as a nicely done bar.

My family and I had reservations here. This restaurant is cavernous and was barely full when we arrived at 6 pm after our afternoon at the theatre. The setting was pleasant; the staff was reserved. The waitress warmed up a bit when I asked her opinion on her favorite dishes. My boys ordered spaghetti with added meatballs. I opted for a Caesar salad and the meatball appetizer. My husband had an antipasti of salami, crusty bread and olives. We were treated to a wooden bread board of bruschetta triangles dusted with olive oil, salt, pepper and rosemary. Delicious. Then came the Caesar salads. They smelled slightly fishy and the light dressing was creamy, yet tasteless. I was disappointed, as was my son.  The antipasti was good, according to my husband. The spaghetti was lightly covered with an orange sauce and the accompanying meatballs seemed to have a deeper and sweeter red sauce. My order meatballs were good sized, dripping in the same sweet red sauce. Can't say they were the best we have ever had. No dessert. The dining experience was fine, but not as delicious as I thought it would be for the price of $144 without tip.

This is a hard area in which to find a decent and decent looking restaurant.  So I will compliment them on the look and the service.  Regarding the food--a beet and goat cheese salad, with four sprigs of argula for $14, was barely a serving.  This is pure profit, although the Caesar salad appeared more ample.  Wine is all overpriced, as is everything else on the menu.  Pasta for $26 barely a serving.  Four scallops for $32, etc.  The best thing was the chocolate torte, very good, for $11, but probably made elsewhere. $4 for a cup of Dunkin' Donuts level coffee.  Will not return.

Everything was perfect. Our server was very knowledgeable with all the different menu items and gave us her recommendations for each course. We both have pastas and they were absolutely divine. I would highly recommend this place, well worth the money.

Unfortunately, our lunch at Casa Nona didn't live up to it's 4-star Yelp rating.  Although it is an attractive, and seemingly popular restaurant, and it has some interesting beers (wines were less exciting), the two dishes we selected were uninspiring (see photos):BOSCO PIZZA...Roasted Mushrooms, Melted Onion, Ricotta, Taleggio, Pancetta ($18)~The undercooked, barely charred crust of this supposedly Neapolitan-style pizzas was a major disappointment, not made up for by the tasty mushrooms on topGNOCCHI...House-Made Lamb Sausage, Gaeta Olives, Eggplant, Ricotta Salata ($25)~Not bad, just very average in every way.  The best thing about this dish were the olives.From the wines by the glass list, I tried the 2014 Luca Ferraris Monferrato Chiaretto rosatto ($16 for 8 oz), which was serviceable, but served in a red sauce Italian restaurant-style glass.  The beers looked more promising.
Fantastic FoodAttentive Wait StaffOutstanding Beet Salad and Pasta!Looks like a great wine menu...Bar area was packedDinner area nice and subdued!Lots of big groups Couples Etc.

Came here for dinner with a high school friend and we left bloated. We ordered way too much..we had the sea bass, crab cakes, gnocchi, butternut squash ravioli, seafood pasta, cheesecake, pumpkin panna cotta, pistachio gelato, and honeycrisp apple sorbet. My favorite was the seafood pasta because the sauce was so rich in flavor. Besides the sauce, they were not cheap on the assortment of seafood. The second best dish was the butternut squash ravioli. It completely met my expectations - flavorful, stuffed middle, and the pasta wasn't over or under cooked, and the sauce was on point. All the other dishes were below average. We didn't finish the dessert either because it wasn't worth the calories. Tables were nicely spaced out. The food service came out in a timely manner and the server was very attentive and social.

Came for lunch the other day. I got the pici alla toscana. It was great the pasta tasted fresh and home made and the sauce was amazing. Full of flavor and very tasty. They also had some sort of bread before the meal. It was very delicious.

WONDERFUL in house pasta with great service and ambiance. Homey and warm... especially on a cool rainy night. We enjoyed the octopus, burrata and meatball appetizers but the pasta entrees were the bomb. And perhaps my new favorite dessert- espresso over vanilla gelato.

WE had the total pleasure of dinner for 5 at Cafe Nonna. In the midst of NYC where most restaurants have tables crowded together, we had the luxury of a large corner booth for 5. Our waiter Manna was wonderful and walked us through the specials and cured meat antipasto options. We share one of the platters of delicious prosciutto and other meats. We had the ricotta and pumpkin bruschetta along with the eggplant caponata. Our meals included the fruitti de mare, squah ravioli and swordfish. All were amazing. We shared a variety of the desserts, one better than the next. The service was wonderful and all of the staff warm and inviting. Can't wait to go back next time we are in the city. A great place all around and the best of our recent NYC trip.

I was slightly disappointed with my dinner. My chicken parmesan came in warm and not hot as I had expected. The plate was hot but not the food. I was expecting the mozzarella cheese to start oozing as I took my first bite. Instead it was hard as a rock. Very disappointed.

Went with 6 business colleagues for dinner on a Monday night.  The food was really good -- the Caesar salad was done properly and my Rigatoni Integrali   (Whole Wheat Pasta, Wild Mushrooms, Butternut Squash, Parmesan, Sauvignon Sauce) was excellent.  The wines are pricey for what you get, and the waiter tends to push the more expensive selections a bit too hard.  So:  food 5 stars; wine 4 stars; service 3 stars -- hence 4 star overall.

Stopped in for happy hour with my best friend. Happy hour turned into a $200 check! Granted, we had a bottle of wine and a beer and additional glass of wine. Because of Lent and the need for a gluten free  food choice, we were sold the special salmon and risotto. This is where I take exception with pricing...the salmon was $33 and the risotto was $29. Really? Although both were delicious, each should have been priced at least $10 less. It really dampened the joy of the evening. We agreed that the next happy hour will be at my apartment around the corner at 1/4 the cost.
All of the food was house made and absolutely delicious. The staff was attentive and the environment was perfect for date night. Will definitely be back again very soon!

I had really high hopes for Casa Nonna given my love for Italian food but I was really disappointed by dinner last week. We ordered the calamari, agnolotti, eggplant parm, and gnocchi. The calamari was small and the fried coating easily fell off many of our calamari pieces which made it visually unappetizing. The agnolotti had so many sour olives which really didn't suit the veal or pasta.The gnocci, although smelled like amazing truffles, was so heavily salted. My fellow diner agreed that the eggplant parm was the best part of the meal as our pastas left us still hungry for some good Italian cuisine. Although the space is nice for large parties and the ambiance was helpful, I wouldn't venture another visit if this was the norm for dinner.

Busy place with ok food. The worst thing in this place apart from the so so food was the staff hovering over your table to get you out as quickly as possible. This place is terrible for a quiet meal at a leisurely pace. Staff rushes in to fill in your glasses, to bring the next dish and the menu and then cheque. I will not return

Make sure you check your bill before you leave! While it was only a dollar we ordered the sorbet. On the menu it's 3 for $10. The bill comes and it was $11. I say something to the waitress, she comes back and grabs the original check out of my hands and replaces it with one for $1 cheaper and says "management adjusted it". Shady if you ask me. Also the hostess said she'd grab us from the bar only to wait 30 minutes and she never came. Much better Italian places in the area.

I seriously think I just ate some of the best pasta- ever. I wandered in on a business trip and asked to sit at the bar. The hostess said "you can sit anywhere. We have tables too and just want you to be happy." What a great way to start. The waitress was quick to the table and helped me pick my Siamese "something or other" and said it was twin pasta. And it was beyond delicious. The flavors were complex and worked so well together with the sauce and mushrooms. Oh and the Caesars salad was really good as well. He's the reason it isn't 5 stars- the bread. They served several triangles of focaccia with the salad and they had some kind of topping but were just completely flavorless. Such a sad thing for such an amazing meal. Fix the bread! I beg of you!!

A rare gem in hell's kitchen!!! Run, don't walk here! This kind of place is hard to find in this neighborhood: it isn't cramped and loud, the food is absolutely spot-on and delicious, and the staff and management take care of you and make you feel at home. This is my go-to place anytime I'm in the neighborhood, whether it's to grab a few drinks or have a nice meal out. You definitely won't be disappointment. I've never had anything I don't like on the menu but the pici alla toscana is one of my most favorite pasta dishes from any restaurant in the city. I've had big parties here and also just one-on-one dinners. Loved the experience of both. And again, I can't emphasize enough the joy of being able to dine at a restaurant where you're not on top of one another or the music is so loud you can't hear the person across from you. It's spacious and most important, the food is great!
Annie is an incredible host. Really good service and we stayed late and they were not upset. That's important . lol Good drinks- "Man with a yellow tie" was good. Try it all
Had a great dinner and good wine list. Ate at the bar.The food was fresh, well cooked & service was quick and thoughtful. Nice place to bring your lady. Will go back.

Great place for a date or to bring out of town family members/ friends.When you enter you think it's a hole in the wall but it's huge inside! Food is great and so is the ambiance. Service was impeccable. The calamari was amazing as well as the filet. Highly recommend the gelato.... possibly the best in town!

Casa Nonna is an excellent Italian restaurant in a part of the city desperate for good restaurants.  The space is open but also classy / cool.  I have gone here on a few business lunches and include it in my usual rotation.  This is also a great place to bring larger groups.  The octopus salad (polipo) is fantastic, as is the farmer's cesar salad.   Pizzas are also strong.  Cheers to them for serving a few fun, local NY beers.

Went here for restaurant week with a friend.Overall, not worth the trip. Not sure if it was the food we ordered or what but the food did not taste good, it was average.The setting is dark, or "dimly lit." I'm not sure if that was dust particles or a tiny flying thing that flew around us and our food. The service was good, they replaced our utensils with nice shiny brand name ones after each plate.We had a cocktail to share, which the waiter kindly put into two glasses for us. Bless him.I had the salad, while my friend had the soup. The salad was the best thing in the restaurant, it had a nice balance of acidity and had mushrooms. The soup was a bit too salty.For the entree I had the spaghetti while my friend had the skirt steak. Avoid the spaghetti, it's the most mediocre pasta I have ever had. Just noodles drowned in tomato sauce, nothing special. My friend liked the skirt steak, but since my body can't willingly handle garlic, I couldn't indulge in her meal as well. So you only have her "mmh mm" to go for how that tasted.For dessert we had tiramisu and apple cake. Avoid the apple cake, it as well is nothing special. Just a kinda dryish cake with some sweetened cooked apples. The tiramisu was better on comparison, sweet coffee flavor to wipe away the mediocrity and wake me up to get the hell out.TLDR: not worth a long trip out here, not worth the high prices they charge for the regular stuff if what you have to go by is their restaurant week quality. Nice staff though. Try for yourself but come with low expectations and you might end up satisfied.

3+ for Casa Nonna!Casa Nonna is great for groups - big space, huge tables, private rooms. Not an intimate restaurant for a quiet meal though.Really enjoyed everything we had - pasta dishes, antipasti, and especially the cocktails! The pizzas are also fresh and creative. If you're looking for a pre-theater meal with a group, check this place out.

Casa Nonna provided more than the traditional pasta and pizza.
