We went for the bronzino which was a pleasant surprise: fish meat was not as fat and rich but very flavorful and the skin was salted and seared fine. As for pasta, we had the tagliolini with mussels and clams and it was delicious. The grilled octupus had more garment than a usual polipo dish but somehow these additional ingredients overwhelmed the original flavor of the octupus and served as a minus instead. Overall Casa Nonna was a solid Italian place worth multiple casual visits.
We loved this restaurant!!! Great for kids and families. Food was excellent and atmosphere was really nice. Warm and inviting. Would definitely come back!

4+baby, weekday, early evening, early winter, rescheese - fine to goodsaladoctopus - goodpappardelle - goodgnocchi - very goodchicken parm - goodswordfish - underwhelmingbroccoli rabenegroniswineThis is the perfect restaurant to catch up with friends and not worry about being rushed, squished, or be annoyed by the food.  The food did not steal the moment, good or bad.  It's a great venue to socialize.  We wanted decent food, not too slammed, near Penn Station, and have some space for a baby.  Something nicer than utility food.It's not precious or rustic but the space is well divided and the tables are spaced enough that even full, it would not feel cramped.  You get the luxury of space.  The booths are especially large, from the sidewalk you'd never know how huge the place is.  Our servers were patient and in obtrusive, the service was very nice.It felt a little expensive for the quality of the food, but it was exactly what we wanted it to be that night and I'd return under similar circumstances.

Wonderful food.  Wonderful service.  We had a very polite waiter who gave us some time to order and didn't rush us.  He let us take our time.  Pricing is average in this market, if not better than other Italian restaurants.   One thing I would like to note here is the background music I heard.   The music set a nice atmosphere.  I was reaching for my iPhone and using Shazam every few minutes.  This restaurant knows what they're doing.  I would love to go hang out at the bar there sometime.  I'm a lighting person, and the lighting had a great intimate feeling.  I will definitely go back there again.   By the way, try the cappuccino because it isn't like the usual Starbucks cappuccino.

The food here was amazing. Every dish we had had truffles in it and I can't complain about that! What stood out to our table was the wine service. We ordered 3 bottles of wine and asked our server to decant one. The somm came over and told me that this wine shouldn't be decanted because "this wine traps more of the flavors by being inside the bottle." Excuse me? If a customer asks you to do something just do it and not make up reasons for your laziness. If you have a suggestion about wine, I'm all ears but I am a certified somm and I can guarantee that decanting will never hinder the flavor of wine. (the Italian wine was over 10 years old, it needed to be decanted.) The snarky/ pretentious attitude from him was a major turn off.  Also the servers kept taking glasses away when there was still wine left and not evenly topping everyone at the tables wine and leaving people out. Other than the wine service, I would absolutely go back. My mother has been several times and I will probably go back again.
Great dinner. Wonderful place. Loved everything except my Swordfish which was too dry. Everything else was 5 star

Maybe dining in is highly reviewed, but do NOT deal with delivery. They quoted me a 850-9pm on a 8:21pm order time stamp.....delivery came @ 9:39pm my food arrived soggy. Keep in mind this is 8-block WALK up 8th ave.....so why quote a delivery window so inaccurate? Forced to order from someplace else costing me me triple but get in 20-minutes...

Tried this place for dinner based upon the great reviews. I was pretty confident going in that we would have a decent dinner. In actuality, the only item that had any actual flavor was the fresh basil leaf on top of the chicken parm. Bruschetta and two mains lack flavor and presentation. Delivery was quick enough. Staff is very informal. It was pretty much a sit down and have a menu thrown at you kind of experience. The atmosphere is great though. Walked in with high hopes, walked out with an $80(without drinks) dinner for two that narrowly outpaces a microwaved TV dinner.

Arrived in got the drinks menu and ordered a drink then ordered food, bar sticky and bartenders don't clean after people leave, the bartenders are really for the service bar sad because I really like the food , waited a while for second drink , entree came still apps plate on my place mat I moved the empty duty apps plate to make space for entree to find the person dropping the entree wouldn't take it , wow , I didn't really like my app but no one asked why I only tasted it , sad
beautiful authentic Italian ambience. Great food and friendly waiters. Would love to make it next time again! :)
Poor service, they didn't have the one dish I wanted... The Lamb shank. Disappointed

There is not a lot of great places around penn station but this is a good one. I was over for lunch on a rainy day - and the place was quiet and chill. Their bread is yummy and pasta dishes was decent.

This place is fabulous. I ordered the gnocchi. It was the freshest, most delicious gnocchi I have had since my grandmother made hers at the kitchen table 40 years ago!My husband had the swordfish. He kept saying how delicious it was during the meal. He loved the potatoes wedges and delicious dipping sauce.We will eat here every time we visit our son here in Manhattan.

I was surprised to find this tasty Italian restaurant at a great location (not to far from Time Square) with nice decorations (not too fancy nor too cheap that you are comfortable to invite a friend you haven't met for years) and reasonable price (considering the location, decoration and the quality of the food).The service is also very nice.

This place is fantastic!  I've been here twice this year, and it's my new favorite spot in NYC, for it's quality of food, and it's range (check out the menu...you'll see what I mean).  I had the Bronzino the first time I was there, and loved it.  Last night I had the chicken parm, and three of us split the octopus appetizer, the meatballs (unbelievable!), and the pumpkin and ricotta bruschetta (this is not what you're thinking...it's not crappy/stale little slices of bread...it is one inch think warm, fluffy, homemade bread...and the flavors were great together).  I brought a bottle of Testamatta the first time, and they only charged me a measly $25 corkage.  I really can't say enough good things about Casa Nonna.  We have a lunch meeting on Thursday 11/10, and I'm going to convince the group to go here.

Came here for a weeknight dinner to meet old friends.  Im a native, and italian.  The food here was good - nothing over the top, but solid.  We ordered the fried calamari, burrata and olives for an appetizer, and they were all exactly what you would expect at any decent italian restaurant.   I ordered Siamese Agnolotti (Veal Ragu, Spinach and Taleggio Cheese , Truffled Pecorino Fondutta, Marsala Glaze) which arrived in a creamy white sauce which was unexpected from the description.  It was very very tasty, but at $26, I expected more than 12 pieces of pasta.  Everyone else in my group enjoyed their meal as well.  Waitress seemed to be having an off day - not smiley and not particularly helpful.

I have been here for dinner and happy hour.  Their meatballs are to die for!  I was worried that it may be a bit touristy as it is near the Theaters but it is a nice big dependable Italian restaurant with good food. There is a very good happy hour selection of wines, beers, and bar menu.  Very good especially for larger groups.

This is a hidden gem! It's tucked away on an unassuming street between a gritty area of midtown and Hell's Kitchen. Not at all where you'd expect to find tasty Italian, and yet...yum!I've made two visits, the first for a quick lunch with coworkers and the second for a big group lunch, and everything was delicious. Salads are fresh and flavorful, pizza has that great wood-fired flavor, and appetizers were all a big hit (we literally ordered every one on the menu). The complimentary bread offered was grilled pita brushed with olive oil and herbs -- HEAVENLY. I think I ate about 47 pieces of it, and I'm not sorry.The other thing that's notable about this place is that it is ENORMOUS. This is rare in NYC restaurants where space is always a premium. This restaurant is really cavernous and has several different dining rooms, but still maintains a pretty warm and cozy feel thanks to the decor and lighting. It feels a little old world but still cool and modern at the same time -- I don't know how they do that!There aren't many restaurants where you could see taking your boss, your parents, your best friend, or your special date, but this just kind of works for everyone. You should go!

An oasis in the restaurant wasteland around Penn Station. Amid the Irish bars, pubs, fast food joints and other pedestrian eats, lies Casa Nonna on 310 W 38th street.  The restaurant is characterized by subdued lighting, inviting bar, dark wood tones, circular booths and an attentive, knowledgeable wait staff. The pasta is home made and quite tasty. Try the lasagna, a unique twist in a traditional favorite. This will be my "go to" restaurant in this area. Tip: Monday's, 50% off on all bottles of wine.

Toasted flat breadCalamariBurattaPasta seafood  misto.  A little too oilyWent there for a team lunch and we're seated promptly at around table which was ideal for us as we wanted to have a discussion. The appetizers included flat breads, calamari and Burrata. Each was tasty with the flat breads stealing the show. The calamari had some spice to it and included some hot peppers and shrimp The burrata was accompanied by fresh tomatoes which is what I tried and they were really fresh and juicy. That entrées varied and i had the seafood pasta which was well laden with fresh seafood and a nice red sauce. The only challenge was that there was just too much oil in the dish. Overall a nice experience and we will be back

In town for Comicon, and they took great care of 18 artists from around the country. The drinks were unique, the spaghetti pomodoro was divine (fresh pasta & a knockout sauce) and the service was top notch.

A group of us went to casa Nonna for a friends birthday on a Friday night. I must say every dish that came to our table was more than delicious!Lindsay the manager was very accommodating to our group and made us feel welcome. I definitely will try to be back whenever I'm in New York!

Excellent decor and limited menu but all the right stuff.Grilled Octopus along with a Margarita Pizza and pasta. Brothers pork chop was tender.Why not 5 stars? Waitress just wasn't or style. Not enough " snap" in personality and knowledge to work with us. No banter. Which adds to the experience for me.

Near Perfect Experience here.Party of 5 went here for a birthday celebration.Drinks were excellent and strong.Staff was VERY accommodating to our party's allergy. I thank the waiter for diligently checking all food. We had no issues with the allergy whatsoever. Staff was attentive. Food was delicious! We all had appetizer, entree & dessert. Burrata was succulent and delicious. Their pastas are always superb. The portions are on the smaller side so I recommend getting an appetizer and entree. Each plate has an amazing depth of flavor.Would definitely come back again.

My girlfriend and I came here last night before Macy's fashion show at Madison Square Garden. Our waiter was amazing- very attentive and made sure we were out in time for the event. The eggplant bruschetta was the best I have ever had. We also loved the garlic toast they served while we were waiting for salad. The atmosphere is warm and inviting for such a big space. I recommend visiting here to get away from hustle and bustle and crowds. Very relaxing well prepared meal with great service! We will be back

The place is fantastic!!!  Went here for an intimate bday dinner at it was just that plus slightly romantic!!!  We went to a Broadway show first (had drinks there) so we wanted a spot close but not all up in the 42nd crowd and hoopla.  So we had a lovely walk down a few blocks and there it was.  great location and the place is beautiful inside.We had reservations so there was no wait but the place is huge!!  Very classic interior with dark woods, of course white linen and a hugh bar...love it!!!!Of course we started with sine and a bit of the charcuterie board....DEVINE!!!I had the filet migon and my partner had the fish!!!!  soooo tastey we have a delicious good time.I would encourage you to try this place i had an awesome time!!!!

We came here for dinner with our friends and it was overall good. The atmosphere was really nice an my husband enjoyed his fillet an hard apple cider.The waiter was nice an accommodating and the place was busy so that's a good signOnly thing is there wasn't a lot of vegetarian selections so I ended up getting a pasta that had mushrooms in it and it just didn't sit well with me.But I would be back if we come back to this part of the country

After spending a long time on Yelp searching for the best place for a special birthday dinner, I came up with Casa Nonna. I was not disappointed!They started us off with complimentary watermelon shaved ice which was a nice touch. After that, we ordered the meatball as an app. To be honest, the bread they brought out with the meatball was probably the best I ever had. Normally I don't indulge in a second piece if I can help myself but it was amazing. The meatball was really good too! For dinner my date had the largest/most expensive steak which he said was amazing (I'm pretty sure he asked for it to go when I barely even saw anything left on his plate, he just couldn't let it go) and I got the chicken parm. I asked to substitute the healthy side of zucchini pasta for normal pasta and marinara sauce since it was my actual birthday and was coming to Casa Nonna to eat carbs (let's be honest).  The side of pasta had great flavor but even though the chicken was slathered in cheese and sauce it tasted rather bland. I'm not gonna hold it against them since everything else was so good, but I wouldn't order that again. I would try something else.Overall, it had great ambiance, and the service was amazing! I wish I could remember his name but he was truly a great waiter and even got them to write happy birthday on my dessert (which was also great).

There is a bar section with tables surrounding a TV and a fully seated area which is where we sat and ate in the evening. To start we simply shared some olives and there were so many different types I was very impressed. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, as me and my brother were hoping for pizza, which was only on the lunch menu, however they were very quick to offer it up when we enquired about it. The service was so quick and we had to wait no time at all to be served. My only qualm would be that it is quite on the pricey side, however for the price the service and atmosphere was lovely!

Food was good--had the lobster salad and Busco pizza, but there were gnats flying around constantly.  Instead of helping, the bus boy mocked us waiving them away!!  Not what you expect at a nicer restaurant.

There's a lot to be said for consistency and one can find that at Casa Nonna.  I've been eating here since 2012 on a semi-regular basis and the food is always very good, the service great, and the ambience excellent.  It's a spacious restaurant with high ceilings and yet it's cozy and the noise level is conducive to conversations.  It's always nice when you don't have to yell at your dinner companions.Reservations are recommended as the place gets busy during the pre-Broadway show dinner hour.Highly recommended items on the menu are the pizzas and the pastas.  The desserts are nothing to sniff at either. Casa Nonna is definitely my go-to place when I'm in the mood for Italian food in the midtown area.

Nice atmosphere, decent wine list and a menu with something for everyone whether it be pasta, seafood, chicken or beef.  Eggplant rollatini appetizer was tender and not too cheesy.  Branzino over cannelini and escarole was very good. Convenient to Penn Station and if you are there on an evening when Billy Joel is performing at The Garden, you will probably be treated to an endless stream of his songs piped throughout the restaurant and bar area.
Wonderful evening. Food impeccable, great choice of wine plus a waiter that could actually give useful advice and didn't just up sell. Wished we'd discovered this one sooner.

Had a wonderful group lunch here arranged by my colleagues. The place is large and spacious, with a modern decor but not one that's monochromatic or anodyne. Not sure how long they've been around but it looks new and well maintained. CN has some personality and is not afraid of bright colors. We had a private room and the space and service were both impeccable.We had a set menu with plenty of goodies on it. The starter salad was good, but the real hit was the grilled swordfish. Portion was generous and the fish was fresh and perfectly grilled. If you see it pn specials or the regular menu, grab it! We also had a sampler of desserts. If I recall, it was Torta Di Cioccolato and the pana cotta. Both were great. Folks who had other entrees, which included a perfectly al dente pasta, had no complaints.Very enjoyable, and sort of off the radar, so check it out.

Omnomnom! So good. I'm not sure what they call these "garlic bread" triangle thingies, but they are absolute magic. They are so thin, I thought they were just like a garlic Flatbread, but wait, there's ricotta in the middle! I have no idea how they fit it in there, but thank you Casa Nonna for bringing it into my life... Oh, did I mention they are comp? And that's just for starters. Just sat at the bar for happy hour, only had pizza, but I knew right away this place is special. Can't wait for my next visit!!

There is a lot to recommend Casa Nonna, not the least of which is that this is an unusually good and pleasant restaurant in a corner of NYC where that is hard to come by.The ambience is excellent--dark, warm, inviting and classy without being pretentious. The place is spotlessly clean. And the staff was great--the hosts were warm and inviting and the servers were pleasant and attentive, up until one moment when we started to feel a little abandoned. We waited quite some time for dessert and the formerly attentive waitstaff seemed to ignore us.  They recovered in very strong fashion by proactively apologizing when dessert was delivered (we hadn't complained) and offering free coffee with the desert. The only thing preventing a five-star review was the food was very good but not great.  It was far from the best Italian we've had in Manhattan (but also far from the worst.)  My wife had lunched at Casa Nonna and felt her lunch entree had been much better than the Ricotta Cavatelli she had for dinner. My Skirt Steak was good but not as tender as some I've had.  The Heirloom Tomatoes and Gazpacho were both tasty.  (I should note we ordered off of the Restaurant Week menu.)  We'd definitely come back, but I hope next time the quality of the food lives up to the standards set by the rest of Casa Nonna's experience.

I went here for the first time on 7.22.16 with some friends.  The ambiance was great.  Dark, cozy, and a great happy hour spot for working folks.  The pizza was perfect and the margaritas were on point.  One of the ladies in my group was here for a second time and our server remembered her!  Tanayah was an excellent server.  I'm looking forward to it becoming "our spot."  I will always request Tanyah!

Great find! We were visiting from Los Angeles and came here with a group of 4 based on Yelp reviews. We were promptly seated and our server arrived within minutes to take our drink orders. We mentioned we had limited time to eat due to our theater tickets and our server could not have been more accommodating. Our food was delicious (we had spaghetti pomodoro, ravioli, pici alla toscana) and the ambiance was pure New York Italian. Loved the decor and tables made out of old wine crates! Highly recommend!

Came at an odd hour for an early light dinner. Sat at the bar. French bartender Antione was charming and knowledgeable. Happy is s great deal running 3-7pm on Saturday. I had the cheese board for $10. Five different cheeses (see photo) all very wonderful.  Brie truly like sweet butter. My fav am oozy stinky ash-washed rind goat cheese. Served with Mesclun salad topped with diced mango, and grapes and pear. Perfect light meal.

I had a spectacular private business dinner at Casa Nonna last night. We were a bit bad about last minute changes - we showed up just before dinner asking for 20 seats instead of 15; however, Batos and his colleague reset the table, printed more menus for us, put a slide on the screen, and even though we stayed too late, the staff was impeccable. Perfect service, great food, great ambiance, it was amazing. They kept the food coming at the right time, the wine flowing appropriately, were respectful of our speeches, and did everything with a smile and poise. I am so grateful to Leigh et al for helping us pull it off!

I read the great reviews and the price (listed as $$ in Google) so decided to give this place a try. First of all, the pizza might qualify for $$, but any entrees a well into the $$$ range, and they don't come with sides, so you order them separately. I had the sea bass for $32 and the Brussels sprouts for $10. With the sparkling water, the bill came to $54.17 - a bit stiff for a $$ restaurant. The sprouts were really good - a solid 4 star. I was really disappointed in the sea bass. Is was one small filet with skin on and a bunch of beans. For that price, I would have expected more, and the presentation left a lot to be desired. The fish was also overdone. I might come back, but I would definitely order something else.  If you come here, be prepared to shell out some big bucks.
Delicious, perfect ambiance, extensive authentic Italian options (great GF menu!!). Friendly knowledgeable staff and overall a great dining experience!

Saw some great reviews about this place, and my girlfriend and I love Italian. We were beyond impressed for a number of reasons and can't wait to go back. Here are my top three: (1) huge, beautiful space where you're not sitting on top of other dinner-goers; (2) service was excellent from the hostess to the waiter. The waiter was very knowledgeable and made fantastic suggestions for us that we absolutely loved; (3) The food was amazingly fresh and our wine pairing (thanks to our fantastic waiter) was excellent. Enjoy this one - you won't be disappointed.
Excellent pasta. Bread was weirdly charred. The salads were good but seemed pricey for what you got.

the place is closed to the javit center so we went there for drinks, we ended up going every day after the show, for drinks. we had pizza and appetizers at the bar.The cocktails are great. the SPRITZ better than Italian. service is smiley and gracious.the food was nice, but i did not really eat... so i cannot say.Nonetheless i plan to go on mu next trip. this may well be my new FAV in nyc!!!Well done!!!

We dined here for a large group dinner (approximately 20+ people), and were extremely pleased with our overall experience. Our party was set up in a private room, where we were still able to get the alluring vibe of the restaurant, without overwhelming other guests. Due to our large party we had a fixed menu. The waiters were very efficient the entire time, constantly checking in with us. We were offered a selection of two different wines, a fixed appetizer, three choices of entree, and two options for dessert. All of the food was high quality, classic Italian cooking. As a picky eater, I was highly impressed. I definitely recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a classy night out to dress up and splurge a little.

I guess this place was ok! I've had better and for the pricey I paid I could of gotten more food. Very small portions. The only thing I actually liked was their meatballs. Waiters were very friendly. Beautiful restaurant but the food just wasn't that great for me or my date.

5 and more! I am really impressed by this restaurant I bumped in on a Thursday night. I am Italian, and I was over the moon for the tastiness and deliciousness of their pizza and cocktails. Me and my boyfriend had an Americano and an Aperol Spritz, and shared a Parma pizza. The dough was just perfect, tomatoes sauce delicious, and the toppings (mozzarella, prosciutto and arugula) were really high quality.. Taste like home. Thank you for making my evening. I can't wait to come back!Also, the atmosphere is really nice. The place is huge, with bar seating area, over bar, and booths. Classy but easy at the same time.

Went here for a weekday lunch with my sister. The interior of Casa Nonna is really beautiful and the food was delicious - loved that eggplant bruschetta!However, I felt disappointed by how long we had to wait for our pizza, and despite what they said, I think they forgot to put our order in.  We were seated right away and they came back with our drinks and appetizers immediately, but it took a really long time for us to get our main entrees of pizza.  We had been long done with the bruschetta before my sister asked if our pizzas (one personal-sized one each) were coming out.  They reassured us it was but it took about another 15 minutes, and told us if we were in a rush to say everything should be brought out at once.  Normally we would, but with the back half of the restaurant (bar in front) being so empty, we didn't think we'd be waiting that long...I mean, it's pizza, right?  And not even a big one!  There was a large (5+) party seated and served around the same time as us, and they got their entrees a lot earlier than us, which is what prompted my sister to inquire about our food.  I kind of got that awkward over-explaining vibe when we asked if they forgot and they insisted they hadn't and that they time serving their food out based on when we've finished our appetizers. Additionally, I wish they did not seat another two person party directly next to us when there were several other small tables available.  They seated them about 30-35 minutes after we were seated.  Maybe this was done because it was convenient for serving purposes, but it was uncomfortable because we could hear their private conversation and they could hear ours.My family is always looking for a nice place to eat before or after a Broadway show, and I know another family member enjoyed her dining experience, so I'd be willing to give it another try since the food was delicious.

We will not return. The place is beautiful the salad was pretty good along with the flat bread but the rest of it was very disappointing. To start the waiter had zero personality and rarely came to our table. He brought us water and then failed to return for quite some time. We ordered cesar salad ti start. It was pretty good and so was the  rosemary flat bread. My husband ordered the twisted pasta with bolognese sauce, now mind you he is Italian and likes his pasta al dente, the pasta was very under cooked and the dish was barely warm.  I ordered the meatballs with ricotta and that dish was also cold.  The broccoli rabe was horrible! I couldn't take a second bite of it. It's a bummer that you go out for a special occasion spend 70 dollars and leave unsatisfied

When we first walked into the Resturant, I thought that it was going to be a great meal. We found out differently as the meal went along and it was subpar in our opinion.  The Resturant was empty for a Sunday dinner, especially since we got there at 545 and finished at 8 pm.  Food presentation looked good but quality suffered. I was surprised that everything that we are from simple salads and routine staple dishes had no true flavor. I had the grilled octopus which was burnt, charred, and the dressing was as if it was watered down.  Next course was the lamp chops which had a beautiful presentation, but again no taste. We had seen such great reviews of this Resturant but most likely will not be going there again...

Beautiful Italian restaurant and bar. I've been here both for a drink and for a weekday lunch. At the bar, which has a separate feeling from the restaurant, I had a fantastic bourbon Negroni with a sampling of the Bruschetta. If you do come to have a sit down meal, treat yourself to a pizza. You will not regret this decision. They are all personal size and it's enough for a meal. I had a special white pie with prosciutto, arugula and figs. I stole a piece of my coworkers Parma pizza, just as fantastic. Can't wait to come back. PS- great place for a business lunch too!

If you're looking for a fancier date night spot, Casa Nonna is it. Just steps away from my apartment, this Italian place is spacious and well-decorated with a refined ambiance. We were a bit late for our reservation on a Saturday night, but grabbed drinks at the bar before getting seated in about 20 or so minutes. We ordered an octopus tentacle as an appetizer, and it was perfectly cooked - amazing texture and on-point chewiness. For my entree, I had the gnocchi, which was also delicious. Definitely trying to make a point to come back here to try more of the menu!

We were at Casa Nonna for dinner on the way to a show. There was a group of 12 of us. I was the only one there on time, as I made the reservation, while all other 11 girls were late by 45 minutes or more! The staff reassured me that pushing back our reservation was okay and made me feel more comfortable about my party's late arrival. Once they finally arrived, everyone was so nice and accommodating about getting our food out promptly, as we were rushing to get to a show. The food was delicious and I'm very happy with my decision to book at Casa Nonna!
Went here during restaurant week. Enjoyed the food and the ambiance.  I think I'd go back to try the main menu.
Fancy italian place for lunch/dinner in Garment District area. Food is pretty pricey and the quality is average. My favorite is the seafood pasta

Solid 4.5!TL; DR: Perfect for if you want to feel fancy, but  still appropriate for if you are eating with a non adventurous eater.  Would eat here again!Alright, here we go!  J and I ate here at 5pm on a Thursday- so early because we had Cirque du Soleil to see at 7:30 and wanted to give ourselves time.  We did have reservations; a father and son walked in ahead of us right at 5 and did NOT have reservations and were told they had to sit at the bar because everything else was booked.  So, make reservations if you want a table!We were seated immediately in a corner booth, perfect.  Ambience is dark and nice, but you could get away with wearing whatever you want. We were in what we call our "dressy jeans" and nobody cared. Our waiter was Leo and he was a complete doll.  When he took our drink order, he first recommended the wine list or something from the bar and we indicated we don't drink, so when I ordered a super boring unsweet tea, he must have sensed that I didn't REALLY want an unsweet tea and he recommended a non alcoholic passionfruit mohito that they make.  He described it so deliciously I just had to get it. And it was every bit as refreshing as he described.  To start we got the fried calamari and the meatballs.  The fried calamari came with fried red sweet pepper, yellow squash and zucchini mixed in.  It was yummy. The calamari were not chewy, the breading held on, and they weren't overly greasy. They just needed a touch of salt.  The meatballs (you get two, maybe 2 inch meatballs) were very soft (I liked the texture, my husband did not) with a small square of parm and a dollop of cold ricotta.  They were delicious. Okay, my only issue with these two things- they were lukewarm.  Not hot.  I like hot food.  This didn't bother my husband in the slightest and may not bother anyone else. I just thought it was worth mentioning. For our entrees, I ordered the porcini mezzaluna and J got spaghetti pomodoro (told you, non adventurous eater).  His spaghetti appeared to be hand made (somewhere at least) and was perfectly al dente.  A bit pricey at $20 for plain spaghetti but, whatever. My mezzaluna was mushroom heaven.  The sauce was creamy and buttery, it came with two large slices of mushroom, and the filling was very very mushroomy.  But again, lukewarm.  Boooo.  When we ordered, Leo was again on the money with recommending a side dish- he recommended the Brussel sprouts and they were the star of the show (for me anyway, J hates tiny cabbages).  They were roasted perfectly with apples, vinegar and pancetta and were divine.  Good call, Leo!For dessert I forced down the pear tart (forced because I was stuffed, not because it was bad).  The buttermilk gelato was awesome.  For the two of us, it was around $100 before tip, so, totally affordable.  I would definitely return.  The service was impeccable-  someone was always on top of refilling water, clearing dishes, Leo was just fantastic in general, and it was an enjoyable experience. Recommended.

I had the seafood dish and it was delicious and fiancé had the gnocchi which was also great. Service was excellent. Also forgot my cardigan and when I turned around to go back, one of the staff had run after me to give it back. Will definitely recommend this place!

Spectacular. Wednesday 7:30 pmService was excellent. Menu, creative while classic. Waiter was knowledgable and just personal enough. Suggested a dish could be created when we couldn't decide between 3 different entrees. Must get Siamese agnolotti. Their meats and cheeses are spectacular. Cocktails eclectic.

Great food, great atmosphere, great wait staff....just a tad pricey,  That said if you're out on business with an expense account or if it's a special night..go for it!  This place is really good!  Get the burrata..home made in the restaurant!

My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday night, and it was a great experience. We started with the octopus salad; the octopus was mixed with grape tomatoes, olives, and potatoes. The octopus was grilled to the right texture and overall we both enjoyed the salad. For the main course I got the chicken parmesan and she got the gnocchi. We were both very happy with how these classic Italian dishes came out. The chicken parm was served with a side of zucchini pasta in alfredo sauce, which was a nice, lighter complement. The service here was also very prompt and friendly--definitely a place worth visiting.

Dinner at Casa Nonna was fantastic.The restaurant is big and open, with homey yet swanky Italian decor. The servers were friendly and knowledgeable, and the menu has something for everyone.We ordered the bruschetta and loved the fava, mint, and ricotta purée and eggplant caponata, but were not huge fans of the liver (not my scene).Salads were huge and delicious, especially the fresh fig and endive!For entrees we ordered the lamb chops, butternut squash pasta, tagliatelle, and seafood pasta. All were beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. Our waiter suggested wine to pair with dinner and it was excellent.We ordered tiramisu for dessert and we loved it! It was perfect, not too sweet.This place is really fantastic, perfect for a date or a dinner party!

Attentive service and excellent food from start to finish.  We arrived to find there had been some kind of mix up with our reservation (they didn't have the confirmation of the reservation our hotel made on our behalf).  No worries, the hostess understood our plight and found a table for us.  One negative, they were out of several whiskeys that we asked for.  No worries, Lindsay, the GM, comped us on two glasses of whiskey that she thought we might like based on our previous selection.Special kudos to Daniel, our server, and Lindsay for providing a high level of professional service.  Would definitely eat here again.
Had the Pork Chops with Pistachios and it was really good! The staff was a little aggressive which is both good and bad I guess but it's a great place. I'd go back.

Came for dinner around 7 on a Sunday night. quiet, dim lit, location.I came here really eager to try to Siamese Agnolotti but with my unfortunate luck, they had a huge party before my arrival and they were in layman's terms: they were "sold out". Disappointed, I picked my next go-to - the Frutti di mare.My mom & i both got the frutti di mare and it was very mediocre. i think it could've definitely had more flavor. i had to pound on black pepper all over it exude some flavor.Service was decent -- kinda slow. I'm not sure if it was because it was SO quiet and not busy that staff was just hanging around not paying attention? but regardless, i wouldn't say it was exceptional.I'd like to hopefully return to try the siamese agnolotti.
The food was OK. Nothing to write home about. We did have really great service so that is a plus!
We went here on a Saturday evening. It was easy to get a large table. Very friendly staff, good food. Maybe too much butter for us and a bit overpriced though.
Do not give these people your credit card information. After I made a delivery order from them my credit card was compromised by about $1,000. Some employee(s) here are theifs

I went back to New York for my 2nd time and knew I had to also return to Cassa Nonna. This time my girlfriend was able to accompany me. Cassa Nonna did not disappoint! I had praised the food and service for over a year. She ordered raviolis and was extremely impressed! We had a few glasses of a pinot noir and when it was all said and done.... 5 more stars.Service was excellent. The wait was only about 5-10minutes. Not even enough time to finish our drinks at the bar. Great food and service!

I came here for a dinner date. The service was great, and very non-intrusive. We took a while to figure out what to order since we were so busy chatting. The server wasn't pushy about it. We came at about 8 pm so it wasn't a super busy time for dinner, on a Monday night. The food was great. It was my first time having Italian in New York City. I had the gnocchi with lamb sausage, which was delicious. Their amuse bouche is a little fried flat bread, which was tasty. I was starving at the time anyway. Their wine by the glass is reasonably priced; I think mine was about $13 per glass, and I had two. Overall, I would recommend this place for a night out with friends, a date, or even business lunches and dinners, as they have larger round tables.

Great for lunch. Thin pizza are delicious. Extremely pleasant wait staff. Tables are generally spaced well so that conversations can take place comfortably.Convenient to Times Square for theater but not in the center which is good. Also love their salads. Fresh ingredients and flavorful. Enjoy

Im sorry but this is not an upscale restaurant, although it tries to be. Lucky for them to be in a high tourist area, hells kitchen and Time Square. I don't think any local would venture here and as I live not far away in Chelsea you will not catch me here again. Fourtunalty I was not that rich to order too much food, and what I did have was nearly uneatable. The Pizza was one jell of an oily dish that it , the grease overflowed through the parchment grease proff paper into the serving pan. Cook forgot to cut the slices and was returned with even more grease on return. I think I eat two slices, but did request to take the rest home with me so I could analylise what a terrible recipe they had worked from or was it just bad cooking from someone who did not care. Overall experience of service backed this up. This was a typical new Youk experience from a restaurant hospitality company that should have known better. Forget your 4 and 5 stars you deserve less than one.

A little oasis in an otherwise drab neighborhood. Once inside, you'll be surprised and delighted to be in such a relaxing and upscale establishment. Good wine list, excellent specialty cocktails, outstanding food... but on the pricey side.Never had a problem getting a table at lunch without a reservation. But my favorite thing to do is sit at the bar area for happy hour (5-7pm) where they offer a little appetizer bite with each drink ordered.The place is not just another bar or restaurant, it's a relaxing getaway that's worth the splurge.

"Surprise me! But it has to be Italian." I'm so glad I got reign of picking the restaurant of my choice for my friend's birthday dinner. I was very impressed with Casa Nonna. And I think my friends were, too. Because of the location, I really didn't have high hopes. I specifically chose this place cause it had leather booth seats. It just looked really nice in the photos...and they honored my request to be seated at one of them.We all "shared" the charcuterie...and honestly, I pretty much ate the entire thing. I got a scallop dish but I was too enamored by the meat and cheese platter, I had my friend finish my main dish for me. Our waiter was very sweet and attentive. Always filling up our glasses of water and wine at the right times.

Look no further for AMAZING Italian food!!!!! Who would have thought so close to Port Authority there is this hidden gem! First of all...their meat balls and octopus are a MUST for appetizers!! Seriously the best meat balls and octopus I've EVER had (anddd I've had my share, especially around NYC). Their pasta dishes are amazing..cooked al dente and seasoned perfectly..nothing is drowning in sauce. Desserts you must try their chocolate torta and tiramisu..aside from the food and service being excellent, the atmosphere is great. This will be your new favorite restaurant, thank me later. ;)

I went here with my mom during the holiday shopping season.  Definitely some of the best and most authentic Italian food I've ever had.  We did the prix fixe because the menu was based on Piemontese cuisine, and we have roots there.  It was a great deal.  This review is a bit belated, I wish I could remember all that we ate, but I definitely want to go back for more!  This is an equally nice place for a date or a large party.

Catching up to reviews so I was here on a business dinner about 4 months ago.Like this alot.  Newly updated and a fair amount of elbow room for a restaurant in this part of town.  Across from a really great little art gallery as well.Very complete menu and all the preparations I saw were done very well.  Nice breads and alot of tightly prepped dishes.  I had the gnocchi and I thought it was top notch.  Fresh and properly cooked, light  and fluffy as it should be.My only concern here is that it was not packed and their service seemed a bit slow.  Took a long time to get cocktails.  Perhaps they were short staffed that evening and our waiter had a couple extra tables but it really could have been a bit more crisp.That said, great experience.  Absolutely great for that part of town.  I would go back...

Located on a sleeper block near midtown tunnel but you'll forget this unfortunate  location once you enter. Great space for groups, everyone at our table of eight had high praise for their meal. I had the gnocchi which was delicious. Service was a bit slow but it place was jam packed and it was peak time.

Amazing quality, greet good great service moderately good prices and the bread which is a rosemary filled pizza doe with 4 cheeses and is thin and light they bring an unlimited amount of and you could basically fill up on that not because you would want to but because it's that good!!! This place is delicious and they have great choices of draft beers for only $5.00. Not far from grand central about 1 mile.

Located in the no man's land where Times Square meet Garment District, this place was an unexpected find.  Step inside, and you'll find a cavernous restaurant with a bar area to the left, venture further, and enter a massive dining room with another bar area overlooking the pizza oven.  The space is richly appointed,  gallery style art walls, massive Leather banquettes, dark wood, and massive floral arrangements.  Very clubby. My companion and I opted for the a la carte menu.  We shared the octopus and garbanzo appetizer and each had a pasta. Mine was the Fruti di Mare, with taglialini in a zesty red sauce.  My friend had the wild boar ragu with wide porcini mushroom infused ribbons.  Both were excellent, and the portions were very hearty. We shared a 3 scoop selection of gelato (pistachio, hazelnut-choc and salted caramel).  Wine list looked good, but I ordered the 1.5 carafe option for $18.  This, to me was one of the best parts of the meal.   The 1.5  glass option was a perfect amount for me that night.  Just enough to enjoy my dinner, and not feel like a lush.

**THIS REVIEW IS FOR RESTAURANT WEEK FEB '16 ONLY**Hmm. I'm struggling to figure out if my party just came on an "off" day, or if Casa Nonna is simply unable to deliver good service during restaurant week. First off, we made a reservation for 8:30pm and arrived promptly. We were told that the party before us were paying, so it would just be a couple moments before we could be seated. Totally fine, except the fact that this went from a 5 minute wait into a 30 minute wait. The place is quite spacious - I don't understand why they could not accommodate my party of 7 at any of the other tables available, especially since they were expecting us. Additionally, we were promised a "nice, gorgeous long table" which is why we had to wait specifically for that, I guess... But then another host approached us shortly after, asking us to check our coats since they planned to sit us at a smaller table. No way - not after you made us wait 30 minutes! Why are two people telling us different things, and what makes them think that 7 people can sit at a regular table for 4?! Give us the table that we reserved for!When we were finally able to be seated, the "gorgeous long table" as promised turned out to be just a regular table and mediocre space... Honestly could care less about this, but it definitely was annoying. The restaurant week menu was $38 for an appetizer, entree and dessert - very average options to choose from. The portions were small and I had to ask for bread 3 times to make up for this. Service was extremely slow and inattentive; the third time I asked for bread, it never even came. On top of all that, the food was just OK. Not terrible but not worthy of a 4 star rating. Very normal and average flavors. I do not feel like this I got my money's worth, especially since our service was so terrible. Sorry Casa Nonna, but I probably won't be back.

Came here for dinner and ordered from both the three-course restaurant week menu as well as the regular menu. The food, service, and atmosphere are all great. Their house rosemary foccacia, while a bit greasy, is a delicious start to the meal and the eggplant parmesan (side order) is a must. In terms of the restaurant week menu, the ricotta cavatelli was delicious, but the portion was small. The chicken entrée was generously portioned and although the sauce wasn't my favorite, I enjoyed it. Overall, it was a good experience and I'd definitely come back!

Celebrated my friend's 25th Birthday here the other night (Mon). The food is beyond amazing but then again you can't go wrong with Italian cuisine. We came on a good night because the wine was 50% off per bottle. The weirdest thing happened where our first waiter suddenly switched with another waiter. Not sure why that happened but he oddly kept moving our plates and wine glasses to where he thought it should go which was annoying. Anyways, the second waiter and rest of the staff were really pleasant. The Gnocchi we ordered was exceptionally good! Check out the pics.

Nothing bad about the experience, but nothing standing out either. Had high expectations for  the pasta - turned to be on the ok side. Decor is nice though - might be a good place to grab a quick dinner before a long train ride.

We had a New Year's Eve dinner at this restaurant. It's fantastic with the food. We had fried calamari for appetizer, it's really good. I ordered the duck breast for my main and it's also tender and delicious. I was also really satisfied with their service. Definitely will come back sometime!

Really great first visit.  Xavier and Leanne were terrific hosts at the bar.  The meatballs!!  Every single review is 100% correct - try the meatball appetizer - fantastic!!  A very nice restaurant, roomy, not noisy, sit at the bar, sit at the open kitchen counter or the main dining room - you won't regret it.  The food, drinks and service were outstanding!  Thank you Casa Nonna, I will return!

This place was absolutely amazing. About $100 for 2 people without drinks, but so worth it! Our server was Cristiano. He was very helpful and his recommended dishes were perfect. My husband had the ribeye, I had the siamese agnoletti and we order the calamari fritti. Best dinner I've had my entire trip!

***********THIS REVIEW IS TOWARD PRIVATE EVENT ONLY! *************We just had our company new year party at Casa Nonna, we had booked the private dining room in the back. We had 23 people in our company and the room is perfect for us, but I would say the best size of group for that room will probably be 20 people if everyone wants to sit really comfortably,  What I like is their private dining room is having TV, so you can bring the video you'd like to play.  My boss made a video about everyone in our office and we had so much fun watching it. The catering menu we had that night was really nice. Everyone got salad  ( d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s! )and they have bread on the table for everyone to share. ( OMG, the breads are seriously amazing!! ) We also got to pick 1 pasta and 1 main course and 1 deserts. For pasta, I picked Twisted Pasta Strands in Tuscan Beef-Pork Ragu, the pasta was a bit undercooked but the sauce was delicious. For main course, I had filet mignon and it was cooked perfectly. My coworkers tried lamb and fish dishes and they really like theirs , too. The service is also top-notch. We had 2 waiters taking care of that night and they've done such a great job, they always make sure our glass was full of wine and was very polite and attentive. Overall, a great choice if you are considering having a reception or private party in garment district. You won't get disappointed!

Randomly wandered in here for lunch one day and highly recommend to anyone looking for something slightly more upscale than the other cafeteria-style lunch spots in the area. The Caesar salad was delicious and for a midtown restaurant the place was pretty quiet which made this place great for a quick business lunch without straying too far from my office. Will definitely come back!
Great food. Even better cocktails!  The wine list is even better some l, great stuff by bottle and the glass. Walking distance to both penn and port authority.

My friend introduced me to this restaurant and I was pleasantly surprised by the homemade pasta! I love also the fact that you can see the kitchen and the pasta being made in front of you!! A couple of things: this place is huge!! There is an endless number of tables which is great because the wait wasn't at all long. The service was really great and they were highly flexible when it comes to creating meals for folks with allergies. You can't go wrong with any of the pastas.I had the gnocchi and it was just fantastic... the flavors all coming together wonderfully.If you have a large group, need to plan a party, or just want delicious pasta - I highly recommend Casa Nonna.
Excellent!  Great food, atmosphere and service.  Wine selection is awesome. I had the pasta and was the best I've had outside of my in laws in Italy.

Might not be a 5 but a 4 is not good enough.  I was very happy to find this place while staying near Penn Station and in town for a trade show at Javitts Center.  The wine selection was very good and I had some of the best gnocchi I have had in awhile.  The serving size for the gnocchi could have been a little larger - but that is my only complaint.  The service was top notch and so was the vibe.  I had the gnocchi at a close by also higher end Italian place the next night and it did not compare!

This review is for service. I had a reservation for 6 people via Open Table on the Friday before Christmas. Four of the people were coming in from the LIRR, which is why I picked this restaurant. At 3:30pm on the day of my 6pm reservation, I received a call explaining that the restaurant was closed for a private party. They did offer to move us to another of their restaurants, but the reviews were not as good and the cuisine was different. (We picked Italian because we had 2 kids attending.) I've used Open Table for over a decade and I have never had that happen. We had to scramble to get another restaurant to accommodate us with 3 hours notice during the busy tourist season. There are thousands of Italian restaurants in NYC. I won't be booking here again.

Batu was the most amazing waiter.  He knew every ingredient and the reason for the great taste! The experience was top shelf and even included a birthday surprise for me! I would highly recommend Casa Nonna and Buta.

Writing this review as I still sit at our table. The BEST spaghetti and meat ball I've EVER had!! Batu was our waiter.. He was so sweet and knowledgable about the menu. Ask for him!! Chocolate cake dessert was so decadent and rich. Freshest and best ingredients that are imported from Italy. This place is too good to be true; great service and will DEFINITELY be back the next time we come to NYC. Highly, highly, highly recommend!!

The food was fine. Nevertheless, the management is likely at the top of the worst in NYC. A polite request was made by a pregnant woman to sit her in a specific location given her special motherly situation. In short, the manager on duty and the regional manager, as they represented themselves to be, recklessly disregarded the pregnant woman's request.Of most shocking disappointment was senior management's offensive demeanor in seeking to desperately justify their unaccommodating, aggressive ultimatum type behavior. To say the least, the experience was only short of barbaric. The only ultimate recommendation I can make to the owners/ senior management of this establishment, is to have a heart felt candid communication with everyone in your staff at all levels, to emphasize any and above all that the customer is always right. The managements' arrogant demeanor, which failed to acknowledge any and all basic fundamentals, is not only offensive but a blatant avenue to guaranteed failure.
Love this place... take clients there ...come couple times a month. the food is terrific and the atmosphere is so special, very spacious.

I dined here for an educational dinner - normally I get the restaurant week treatment during these things but Nonna puts out solid food which definitely deserves praise. The restaurant is quite large and bustling; there's low lighting and a darker color scheme (mostly browns) which gives off a warm, intimate feel. Not exactly "grandma's house" (the English translation of the restaurant name) but it works. We had a limited menu to choose from, and most things were served family style with the exception of the entree. They started us with apps consisting of their "famous meatballs", octopus paired with roasted pepper and olives, and fresh mozzarella paired with sweet peppers. Everything was super tasty, but the standout for me was the meatballs - they were quite good, definitely the real deal. The pasta course was cheese tortellini paired with basil and cherry tomatoes. The tortellini were large and filled with a perfect amount of cheese. For the main I had the swordfish which was paired with tomatoes, olives, and capers. The fish was good and paired well with the side. Additionally there were family style sides of spinach and roasted potato spears. Finally for dessert they served chocolate pudding cake with vanilla gelato and passion fruit panna cotta.Everything was great - quality food and good service as well. I would consider coming back here to explore their full menu.

This place rocks! Homemade PASTA! Pizza Bar! - GREATI've had some disappointing meals in NYC during my travels, but the homemade pasta was a WIN here! This place is huge, clean, our waiter was excellent. I loved my sparkling water, caesar salad, and pasta dish. My sister had the Cheese tortellini dish, which she LOVED. I will absolutely return for a meal as CASA NONNA. It's not the best meal i've ever had, but it was VERY good I would highly recommend going here!Pricey but the portions were good! Better than so many other NYC places including Italian restaurants in "Little Italy."

This is my first ever Yelp review. So many things went wrong...1) I ordered a simple vodka martini, no vermouth, little bit of olive juice (not quite dirty). First one more than 15 minutes after ordering) came out with a little bit of orange juice? Waited another 15 minutes and finally got my first drink. 2) Ordered a steak, RARE. Came out medium. Didn't have the time to send it back even though they noticed themselves that it wasn't rate, offering to make another without having to even complain. This restaurant is owned by Jimmy Haber of BLT, so they should be on their A-game with steaks. 3) Ordered a second martini right before my steak came out, this time it was just a club soda with ice. They realized they sent me the wrong drink, and the EXTREMELY RUDE GM LINDSAY came over. She said "We got your drink mixed up (not an apology whatsoever, she was almost mad she had to come to our table). That's a Ketel One martini with no vermouth and a little bit of olive juice, correct?" (Yes). "Okay, because the sooner I leave this table the faster you can have your drink". SO RUDE!! But it gets worse - She comes back with my drink (they are now 2 for 4) and says "Here you go sir, shall I go ahead and put an order in for your next martini now?" As if I'm a raging alcoholic - I just wanted two martinis as I was out to dinner with my mother and sister!4) It was a special occasion - my mother's 59th birthday. The manager, Nick (who unfortunately has to report to GM Lindsay), was extremely kind and apologetic - as a restaurant manager should be when his/her staff makes mistakes. He took the steak off our bill and generously delivered two delicious desserts to our table for my mom's birthday. The experience was terrible and I would hate to work for Lindsay. I think Nick should have her job, she is a terrible manager from a customer's perspective. If I ever go back I definitely won't be ordering a steak, and might stick with wine because you can't screw up a wine order too easily.

Ok.....so I have tried many, many, many, meatballs......some call me Meatball!!!!The meatballs at Casa Nonna are the best I have had in NYC so far....yes I am going to go out and make that statement!!!!  Beef and pork meatballs so tender, so tasty and perfectly spiced.....the consistency I believe a meatball should be....soft juicy falling apart in the sauce meatballs.The sauce tastes supper fresh San Marzanno tomatoes fresh basil..fresh garlic sautéed perfectly with very good tasting olive oil... really nice!!!!!The Frutti Di Mare was delicious.  The homemade pasta was good.....if you are not used to fresh pasta it may surprise you-cause it's almost as though it may seem a little more chewy then pasta out of a box)The seafood was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was delicious.I will definitely come back again!!!!

I really love this place, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is great! I had the prefix 4 course and everything tasted really yummy! I was there with a group of friends and they all loved their food. There is a nice selection of beer and wine. The service was great too. Def would come back!

I treated a customer to lunch at Casa Nonna. This is a perfect restaurant for a business lunch. It's nice and quiet and plenty of spacing between tables. The menu is a perfect combination of moderately priced salads and paninis to more pricey main entrees. The portions are very very generous. I ordered the chicken panini and it was huge and delicious. The waiters were very polite and the service was excellent. This will be primary go to restaurant for business lunches when I'm in the West 30s.
Excellent food and service. Had the Veal check which was to die for as well as the Pizza. When you walk in it looks like a sport bar but whined is the restaurant which is a gem.

Yum.  I enjoyed a squash ravioli that was very good. Although it reminded me of peanut butter. We requested bread that came when we were about done eating but it was worth the wait. So good. I tasted the other squash dish that was also very yummy. I had the Brussel sprout app. Very very tasty.

My dining experience was exceptional here. The food was spectacular and the service was phenomenal. The servers are all very helpful, and all servers that walked by asked if we were ok or needed anything. The restaurant is fairly large overall. They have a bar area, an area where you can watch the chefs (open kitchen), and tables and booths in the middle of the restaurant and back. I liked how the booths included pillows for comfort and decoration. I ordered the Raviolo All'uovo and it came out within a reasonable timeframe and was superb with wine sauce, and truffles to top the ravioli off with a nice after taste. Truly a hidden gem. I would recommend this restaurant to any Italian lover.

A little pricey but this place is pretty tasty.  3.5 star. I've come here with a dear friend mainly for drinks and apps but finally came here for a full blown dinner last night. We made a rez at 645 pm and the restaurant was pretty full at this time.  We were served a little slow (service was all around a little spotty) but the food was yummy and the restaurant is spacious and has a nice, elegant atmosphere. We had:- Complimentary, yummy fresh baked flatbread with some kind salty cheese inside- A coppa plate which came with pickles, olives, and rustic bread. Plentiful and tasty- A hard sheep's milk cheese parm like bread which came with a sweet nut like honey and PR jam. The jams were a bit weird and too sweet but the cheese was lovely.-I had the Spinach/veal agnolotti which was truly very creamy, rich and tasty. It was very beefy- more beef than spinach. The pasta were all home made (every pasta dish is), and looked very unique and fun. -My friend had the duck breast. Unfortunately it was overdone the first time so they quickly took it back and re fired another...seems like the second time around, while cooked properly, it was less duck. Hm.  Kind of a dish you don't want to screw up for $37. -Lastly...I didn't try it but my friend swears by their tasty chicken parm so maybe give it a try if you want something heartier. We passed on dessert in lieu of wine. They DO have really delicious wine here - all Italian and the server knew his stuff.  He suggested a Sav Blanc like crisp choice for my friend (Venedictino? something liek that.  And a full fruity cab like option for the Angleinzo... blaah I can't spell or say Italian wines, ha). My friend and I dig it for proximity to her place but otherwise it's not worth going out of the way for. Not many good eats in the desolate garment district, anyway.

My new favorite restaurant in NYC! The service was fantastic. Our server Cristiano was very informative and super helpful, his recommendations were spot on and I can't wait to come back and try something new! His impressive knowledge of every dish perfectly complimented his warm and professional personality. We will definitely be back! We couldn't stop eating the focaccia bread, then the salad came and we couldn't get over how good the pears were! The butternut squash rigatoni blew us away, what a dish! Thank you Cristiano we look forward to dining here again!

This is probably one of the best culinary experiences I have ever had in my life. The food was outstanding and the service was even better. Not only was my table treated very well, but every occupied table in the restaurant was taken care of in the best, most professional way possible. The food was probably the best Italian food I've ever had in my life, and I've had a lot of good Italian food. The pasta was most definitely hand-crafted on site (I can tell because I also make my own pasta from scratch at home), and each dish was carefully cooked to perfection. First, I had a small pasta dish in a delicious bolognese sauce, which was amazing. Then, I had the Polpettine, a meatball appetizer, and let me tell you, these were the best meatballs I ever had in my life. This was followed by a pizza shared by the whole table, which was also to die for. I'm a little unsure of the exact ingredients because it was custom made by the chef. Then, I had the Chicken Parmesan as my main dish, and that was also delicious. My only comment on that is the chicken is huge! I think it might be a little too much, but at this point in the meal I was already stuffed so I think that would best be served without all the appetizers I ate. The desserts were also fantastic. The Panna Cotta changed my life.

Food was great all around. Service was pretty slow and they forgot about our appetizer order. I think it may be a server specific issue, due to others around us getting their food much more quickly even though they were sat 10-20 minutes later.
Had the mushroom, rigatoni with butternut squash.. Amazing.. Some of the best pasta I've ever had!!! Highly recommend!!

The restaurant is between 8 & 9 th  Ave on 38 th street.  Neighborhood more industrial but this is a very good Italian restaurant.   Large open dining area.  From pizza to excellent home cooked entrees.  Definitely worth the visit

When we walked in we were greeted by music from our own era. Aren't all magical places like that? The wait staff was beyond competent - making great suggestions throughout the the night.  I like them all including the slightly hipster busboy who did a great job.The food was excellent.  Highlights were the complementary foucacha, the pizza we ordered was the amazing Bosco. The pasta was agnioteli  (sp?) with veal and spinch, the Brussels sprouts were not to be missed  oh and lets not forget the starter soup of garbozo bean and fennel sausage. All very worthy or ordering again. Now something you don't see in a great Italian restaurant - the House Cocktails - we had so much fun we tried four- Siren's Punch, The Witch Hunt (fun name right?), Harvey's New House (my favorite) and the Peachy Monkey. Next time we are in town we will be back.

This is a great restaurant for the area.  It is one of the nicer upscale establishments.  Very large dining area with a separate bar area.   Food is very good, service attentive, & the ambiance is great.  Definitely a must if you're looking for a bit more fancy in this neck of the woods.

We picked this fabulous lunch spot based on yelp reviews and pics. We had the calamari, a bottle of wine, and 2 pasta dishes and it was all fantastic. Service was great. Food was spectacular. Highly recommend!! Bonus - it's gorgeous inside.

Casa Nonna is a chic Itaian restaurant on W 38th street. They make great pizzas (our son had one for an appetizer) and incredible, unique pastas. I got the farfalle integrali which was fresh and delicious. My husband got the Pappardelle Al Porcini which he was a bit hesitant to do and loved it!!! Our son got the basic Chicken Parmigiana with a side of spaghetti and also loved it. The service was just ok- it wasn't even crowded. We had to wait awhile for our cocktails- never a good thing!!! Having our 14-year-old son with us, we had to ask for bread as he was starving... They brought out four pieces of flatbread shaped in a triangle, needless  to say, he ate all four of them!!! A bit pricey as well, even though the food was great, chic  atmosphere, I would rethink going back for a second time  as there are many other great restaurants in the city, with great food with lower costs.

Not really impressed here. After a round of decent appetizers me and the people around me all had steaks. Filets and rib eyes. Each and every one of them (half a dozen) were cooked incorrectly. My rib eye was charred outside and raw in the middle (ordered medium) and was very grisly.  The guy next to me ordered a filet Medium Rare and it was well done - absolutely ruined. We had a train to catch or I think it all would have gone back. Service was great (party of 12 or so), kept the drinks going, but the steaks here are not recommended. Everything else seemed OK.

I started going to Cassa Nonna the day it opened in 2011 and live in Emerald Green (the apartment building on top).  Full disclosure, I have been banned from going into this restaurant for the past 9 months.  I recently tried to go back in and was asked to leave.  No argument and left.  I will get back to the banning reason later.  Prior to my banning, I ate here on average once or twice a week and spent thousands of dollars, made friends with bartenders and always tipped 25 to 30%.  For a while they gave residents of the building 15% off on Sunday nights.  This made sense because the prices are high, but the quality is high.  Sometimes the portion sizes were not customer friendly (especially the Octopus).  They are part of eSquared with a rewards program that you basically get no benefit from except if the bartender feels like hooking you up, which did happen from time to time.  The reason for 1 star and my banning is because of the female floor manager (name I believe is Lindsay) who called me rude one night because I asked for the free drink that the rewards program gives you once in a while, but I didn't have my receipt.  I asked her to make an exception and she wouldn't.  I tried to ask her again and said I was not happy.  She said I was rude and always rude to everyone (staff) all the time and that I returned Octopus one night.  I was always nice and a regular, but expect proper food.  I was furious that she could say this to a customer and instead of making a scene in restaurant I called her from upstairs and I did yell at her.  Probably not the best reaction, but she was infuriating!  I went in the next day and she said that I had to leave and the police would be called if I didn't leave.  I left and wrote the President of eSquared.  They sided with her.  She should have never called me rude.  The point of my story is that this is an arrogant, overpriced, and corporate restaurant.  I have lived in this location for 6 years....just go to TAVOLA (on 9th avenue between 37th and 38th) right around the corner.  Better food, better service, more authentic Italian and much cheaper.  This is the unbiased truth!
I'm totally addicted to their pappardelle alle porcini. Must have ordered it 5 times now and is always just soooo delicious. Not tried anything else...yet...get the pappardelle!
Great place for after work drinks. Great atmosphere. Free appetizers with the drink is a nice touch... Brings back the European memories.
Very accommodating, as we where in a rush for a meeting. The service was great and the food was just as good. It will be one of my regular stops.

This was the only Italian restaurant I tried while in NYC and I was a little disappointed. I came in expecting free bread (maybe I'm used to "fake" Italian restaurants like Olive Garden since they give free salad and breadsticks with your meal). But that's not the reason why I gave 1 star.We started off with the Calamari Fritti appetizer. The calamari was not too bready and had a decent flavor. My only complaint was that for $13 there didn't seem to be enough calamari. The julienne vegetables made the dish seem bigger than it actually was and the dish looked underwhelming, to be honest.Our entrees took forever to come out. For my dish I ordered the Farfalle integrali. The pasta was undercooked - it was just so hard that I thought maybe it was because it was wheat pasta that made it so hard. But then I tried my sister's dish - Pici Alla Toscana (with non-wheat pasta) - and her pasta was hard as well. Both were so unenjoyable. As a girl with a sizable appetite, it was the first time I did not finish my entree and I normally LOVE pasta. Maybe they were having an off day but I was disappointed especially after seeing this restaurant have 4 stars on yelp.

Let me first start off by saying that anyone complaining that food takes too long should not be dining at a place where they make everything fresh, in house. McDonald's is down the block. Now on to my review. I've been coming here for the past 3 years (dinner, lunch, restuarant week) and never once had they disappointed. The food is absolutly delicious. Italian food unlike any other (coming from someone who grew up with a real life Nonna!) Pastas, sauces, pizzas, cheeses, meatballs, gelato, desserts, etc. are all made in house. The service is very attentive without being intrusive. They are very accommodating and make sure you are having a wonderful time. The restaurant is very spacious but at the same time, surprisingly very intimate. Even with a crowded dining room, you could hear your guests and not others. It feels like you're dining at someone's home. This is truly a "hidden gem" as it is located in the middle of a block between Times Sq. and MSG. I've been here many, many times and still walk past the front door :) I've brought friends, family, and coworkers here and all have loved this place. If you're in the area and want to "wow" someone, this is the place to do it. Any meal you have here is sure to impress!

Good restaurant with a nice atmosphere and great service-- all of which are hard to find in this part of NYC which is ridden with tourist traps. It's a good spot for large groups because it's so spacious. The service was fantastic and the food was good. Prices were not outrageous. I much prefer hole-in-the-wall Italian restaurants further downtown, so I won't necessarily come back unless I'm in the area. However it's a great, convenient spot to go before a Broadway show or a concert at MSG.
The foods are fantastic. My favorite is the calamari frite, and my boy friend s favorite is the meatballs. Its a good place to date tho.

I went during restaurant week on a Friday night - 7/31/15. Our party had 7:30 reservations and I was running late, about 20 minutes, but my party was seated at the bar, then at a table at the 15 minute late  mark. When I arrived, the host was very friendly and took me straight to our table. Our waiter came over immediately and asked if I wanted a drink, I waited and he asked if we wanted to order our appetizers, we said we'd review the choices and then order. Of course, the menu wasn't extensive, as it was just a few choices for restaurant week. So, we had the waiter come over and asked about the sweetbread app, he offered to describe every dish on the menu (this should happen at any restaurant). We said, we'd think about what we wanted and I ordered a Blood Orange margarita.  Our waiter brought over a plate of their EXCELLENT grilled foccacia. Mmmmm!I chose the Heirloom Tomato, my cousin and friend both had the Fluke Crudo.  We laughed at the small sizes of the apps and said, if this is the appetizer, we know the entree will be small too. The heirloom tomato was good, the buffalo mozzarella was stellar, I could have just eaten that and the foccacia. I tasted the fluke and it was tasty, I'm not a raw fish person, so I wouldn't personally order it. The glaze was excellent though.  On to the dishes... We each chose one of the three available entrees.  I had the Ricotta Cavatelli, my cousin the Lamb Tenderloin, and our friend, the Black Sea Bass.  While their portions were small, as expected, my pasta was a heartier dish than I thought. EVERYTHING was delicious! We asked for more grilled foccacia, we were accommodated. Our water glasses were refilled constantly and we were checked on periodically.  Dessert choices were Tiramisu and Passion fruit Cannoli. My friend didn't want either and he was able to substitute with a nice serving of gelato. All three desserts were great. Throughout dinner we laughed about possibly needing to go elsewhere after to have full bellies.  Rest assured, by the time we had our desserts - we were all full and satisfied. Everything came together completely. In total, we were there about 3 hours and never felt rushed to be done. Our bill was about $200 - $38 each for the restaurant week menu,plus drinks and tip. I really wish I would have remembered our waiter's name, he was very nice. The decor and ambiance is very nice and inviting. I would definitely go back again. It's a nice place to get together at and have a delicious meal.

Last night was my first time here and I don't want anyone else to make the same mistake.. The service was awfully slow (although we did sit in the bar area). I got fried calamari as an appetizer (kind of dull) and I ordered the Siamese Agnolotti which the server recommended and said it was her favorite thing on the menu. To keep it short, the food wasn't appetizing to say the least. Today I spent my morning at the emergency room for food poisoning and have been throwing up all night. This cost me more than just the pricey dinner which I expected so much out of and I couldn't be more disappointed.

Good enough but not memorable. Best part was the bread (was there a tiny bit of cheese in there...MMMMMMM)Tried the Restaurant Week Summer 2015 menu for lunch. The food was good but nothing worth going back for. Salmon was cooked well (comes as medium but I asked for medium rare) and made for a delicious, albeit predictable, meal with the quinoa. Had the tiramisu for dessert and it was average. Cannot remember what I had for appetizer (you get the idea...)Should be a 3.5 but what knocked this down to a 3 was this obnoxious duo next to us who were SCREAMING about how much money they are making and how many companies they have bought and sold. I'm in tech and had no idea who these guys are but they certainly ruined what should have been a cozy lunch experience.

Came in during restaurant week for lunch and had a delicious meal. Everything was cooked perfectly! Prosciutto and melon with Parmesan cheese (arugula and endives were near invisible) was good, coffee spiced pork tenderloin was perfectly cooked with a tasty coffee-port jus. The recommendation of limoncello granita instead of tiramisu made for the perfect ending. I usually don't eat dessert but the granita was just right, light and lemony; the basil cream was just the right touch!

Absolutely spectacular! I literally went there for lunch everyday! Do I've tried nearly everything on the menu. I'd strongly suggest the agnolotti, gnocchi or the tuna loin salad! They're all amazing, so much flavor and so tasty! They also have amazing coffee (specifically their espresso!)

My colleagues and i visited here to celebrate a graduation.At the bar we all had a blood orange Margarita - very very good but "tasted like trouble" so i limited it to one.At the table, 4 of us split the Polpettine (meatball), Peperone Dolci, and Calamari Fritti (fried calamari) appetizers -all very good. Our entrees were: polla alla parmagiana, a filet, lamb chops, and (mine) Mezzelune di mais con astice. ( Lobster/seafood ravioli in a lobster cream sauce) Not a one of us had a complaint.
